When the food arrived my sandwich had a 1/2" x 1.5" piece of cheese on each half and no dressing.  After denying there wasn't enough cheese, I had them take it back and do it right.  To my shock, they added a surcharge for the cheese!

If you go there, maybe you'll get a better server and a kitchen that knows what it's doing.  I won't be back.
author: Scott N.

description:
They need better restaurant management taking orders, drinks, serving food.
Walk in 545pm with our reservation at 600pm. 
called waiter to order food 616pm.
Waiter disappeared and no food or status on our order at 650pm. Update  we got order at653pm. 
Need to catch symphony at 730pm.

TIP
Do NOT  eat here if in a hurry!
author: Clifford W.

description:
SLOW SLOW SLOW.  That sums up the experience.  We were seated at 5:30pm, and our server didn't bother to stop by for nearly 15 minutes.  We placed our full order, and then proceeded to wait nearly another 30 minutes for food.  Our server didn't bother to even stop by at any time while we waited.  The food was uniformly mediocre.  Our server ignored our request for the bill, and dumped the dessert menus off.  She then seemed insulted when we told her that we didn't want dessert (primarily because we didn't want to wait), and wanted the bill.  That took her another 10 minutes.  

If the service wasn't so horrifically slow, it might be worth returning. But the food isn't all that special, certainly not for a 2 hour dining experience.
author: lonni f.

description: What's left of my turkey burger! First time I waited less than 15 min for my order at the takeout counter and now I know why! Not fully cooked! The place was packed! Should've gone with the Matzo Ball soup!
author: Neni E.

description: I'm a long-time patron of the several Bay Area Max's.  So, I'm well acquainted with the quality of their food and service.  BUT, I wanted to try their delivery from WAITOR.COM.....very, very bad idea.  Beginning with the order confirmation, it was one bad experience after another.  After placing an online order at WAITOR.COM, in the early afternoon, I finally received an order confirmation at about 5:30pm.  The food was supposed to be delivered to my 98 year old Mother who was waiting since 5:30 to receive her food.  After 6pm, my Mother's caregiver called me and asked 'where's the food'?  Bottom line, this was a horrible, avoidable situation that could have been avoided if Waitor.com had MORE COMPETENT people working for them.  Back to Caviar, Munchery, Eat24, DoorDash, gladly!!!
author: Carolyn M.

description: Not one of the best steaks but it is okay if you have it with salad. I recommend this place because of the generous portion and reasonable price.
author: Hailey Y.

description: A friend and I were rushing to a Symphony while looking for food. We saw the good reviews and decided to give it a try, seeing as to how it's only about 4 blocks away from Davies Symphony Hall. They provide so much dining space, and the black walls make for a fancy ambiance. We were probably the youngest people in there! What truly makes this cafe fancier than most, though, is the pianist serenading diners with Sinatra and other love songs. They are at the perfect volume so that it is not overbearing to conversation/general restaurant function. There is also a bar. The menu was average American food, but seemed to involve more unique presentation and/or ingredients. Definitely pricier too, but the portion sizes were generous. The French fries with the fish and chips are seasoned and so delicious, but the fish being breaded differently took a little bit of getting used to. Despite the outside of it, the inside of the fish was perfectly prepared! Our waiter checked in on us more than once & allowed us to get our check early and get take out boxes once we asked. There's a cute sign on the door saying "good for a diet, bad for a diet, critics are not welcome!" The ambiance was a breath of fresh air, so we will have to visit again whenever we have more time to thoroughly enjoy it.
author: Aly G.

description: $30 for a lunch special. That's way too overpriced. Chicken was good but too pricey. I'll go grab a whole chicken for $10 at Whole Foods. Good service but overpriced.
author: Taryn M.

description:
The service is great but I can only give three stars mainly because of two reasons. First, unappetizing drinks. My brother's Arnold Palmer tasted like Lipton iced tea loaded with pure lemon juice and my Bloody Mary was way too peppery and bitter. Secondly, cold food. I think they wait until all dishes are ready before serving. We're party of eight and it should take more than five minutes. My brother chopped steak dinner already gone cold when it arrived and you know how medium rare would taste when it's cold; soggy and watery.
Monday's special; a little too salty chicken quesadilla served with sour cream, salsa and cacuamole altogether in a small container, and delish Caesar salad.
author: Yanakon D.

description: Great food and fast service before we went to Hamilton show!  Our family had a delicious Reuben, chicken pot pie, fish tacos, stuffed mushroom fettuccini, and battered fish and chips!  Ended evening with tasty desserts like key lime pie, waterfall cake, and brownie sundae. Yummy and had a great piano player who sung our favorite songs at request:).   Wish is was back in San Jose!!!
author: Carie D.

description:
During our company lunches I like to order at Max's. Tatiana took care of me today, and she went above and beyond with customer service.

Some of my favorite orders:
Chicken Salad Wrap With Grapes & Walnuts (It includes Avocado) - Excellent!
BLT w/Avocado
Pastrami
Caesar Salad w/Chicken

The meals are enough for two people, at least my opinion.

I like the friendly staff, and I enjoy ordering for big lunches here.
author: Raquel I.

description:
I have brought large groups here, and they never disappoint with good food, prices and service. 

A fine place to have a drink or pre-show meal. I have also tried Soluna Cafe nearby, and suggest all avoid it unless you enjoy being treated rudely by management and have to wait eons for food and drink. not so at Max's. I'll come back here often!

UPDATE: After two very successful group meetings at Max's, they really let me down. I brought in about 15 people and had discussed our needs with the manager in advance, how I wanted the tables and such, and all of it was completely disregarded. The manager was not there when I arrived, and the replacement and servers looked at me like I was green with three heads when i told them of the plans I had made with the manager.

I've brought them a bunch of business in the past. No more. I'm going to the Cadillac​ Bar and Grill instead.
author: J L.

description: I love the way they decorate the restaurant with Christmas light and it felt like holiday spirit . it felt warm and comfortable.  We have a table outside and It is nice to be able to look outside from the big windows. I order the 1/2 corn beef sandwich and 1/2 sausage gumbo soup, there are a lot of meat in the sandwich and in the soup too. I was full from my meal. also, the food came out pretty fast even though the restaurant is busy,  I have to give a 2 star to the waiter. she was a bad server and she doesn't come around to ask us for more water or do we need any help. when we ask for the check, we wait for almost 10 mins for her to come and bring us the bill.
author: Isabelle L.

description: Slipping. My chicken sandwich was so dry I couldn't put enough mayo on to rescue it. My friend's Cobb salad was better with fresh Bleu cheese.  I should have stuck with the basics and ordered the reuben.  The piano was beautiful and service was nice.
author: Tony B.

description: Been going to Max's for a long time. It was always worth paying a little more, because the quality and quantity was there. Today's meal was a disappointment. I decided to not order my usual, and went with the Thursday special, roast turkey sandwich with mashed potatoes, gravy and cranberry sauce. Where the establishment failed was with the turkey. In the past, it had always been fresh. Today, it was that slippery, salty, packaged stuff. This was not an acceptable way to cut corners. The meat was almost inedible. The mashed potatoes were the good kind of lumpy, the gravy was fine, as was the cranberry sauce. But, the main attraction was a failure. I won't be going back soon. I would have given the place one star. But, the service was efficient and friendly.
author: Bob B.

description: Very, very bad. Sticky table, disgusting "Asian salad", with vinegary tasting chicken, its deep fried breading falling off the meat, all while ripping you off at the tune of $17. Cheap tasting but expensive Sauvignon Blanc, $10. Never, ever eating there again.
author: Suzann B.

description: Service is good and the food is great I have been eating here for years and I am glad that the food hasn't changed because it is excellent I love the soup and the corned beef
author: Danielle M.

description:
We had lunch at Max's Opera Cafe today (8/3/15), and although it was good overall, there were a few things that could have been improved a bit. Our server was wonderful, and our table could not have been better, and although the prices were on the higher side, I wouldn't say they were too high given the very generous portions. But some of the food wasn't quite 5-star.
Caesar salad: Average (but high marks for the perfect amount of dressing)
Cabbage soup: Excellent
Salmon sandwich: Good, but with a mayonnaise based dressing spread too thick, and a little too salty 
Vegetable omelette: Good, but slightly dry, and a little too salty 
Fries: Good, but could have been crispier (on the outside)
Coffee: Above average for a regular restaurant not specializing in coffee 
However, despite a few things about the food that weren't perfect, it was a good experience overall, and we would definitely come back.
author: Madeline S.

description:
Given their high prices, their flavorless food gets only one star from me. Ownership of the restraurant has obviously changed because Max's Opera is light years from the great New York-style deli it used to be.

A friend took me to lunch there recently and the food was awful. My dry hot pastrami sandwich looked and tasted like crap from Safeway's deli. My friend had some type of hot meat that was drowned in a cheap, sugary barbecue sauce. The watery cole slaw dressing had way too much vinegar in it. The potato salad was stale and dry. Portions were scrimpy. We didn't bother with dessert.

If you want a good deli-style meal at a decent price, go to either Miller's East Coast Deli on Polk near Sacramento or to Tommy's Joynt on Van Ness near Geary. They're not fancy, but their food is much better than ripoff Max's.
author: Pam J.

description: What happened to this place?!  It used to be so good.   Loved this location and Marin when it was there.   We came for lunch on Saturday,  and the restaurant was pretty quiet.   Service was friendly and quick, so one star for that.   Food was pretty mediocre.   I got the $9 cup of matzo ball soup that was so salty it was inedible.   I really should have sent it back.   Max should contact Miller's on how to make good matzo ball soup that doesn't cost anywhere near $9!   My husband got the brioche french toast that tasted similar to Denny's or IHOP, but again at a much higher price point.   Really disappointed at how far this restaurant has fallen!
author: Marie B.

description: Something has changed at Max's..they appear to be cutting back on food costs. Now it is a struggle to get a simple dinner roll with a bowl of soup.The floor manager at lunch needs to settle down and start taking care of his clients..or they might just go away. Plus they have eliminated their cloth napkins to cheap paper ones. Ugh. Now they charge this bogus SF offset benefits tax..check your bill and don't pay it. This is the responsibility of the restaurant ownership not the patrons. DON'T PAY!
author: David S.

description: This is our go-to restaurant for when we go out to a symphony performance.  I get my usual:  Guy's Chinese Chicken Salad and my husband usually gets a Cobb salad.  We're both happy afterward, what can I say?  I've had their pastrami (or was it corned beef?) sandwiches and was equally happy, too.  I love their latkes, too, but what does a Filipino guy like me know about latkes?  ;-)
author: Glenn P.

description:
What do you get when you cross a Lipton type chicken soup package with frozen carrots and grey matzoh balls? Max's indigestion. With each visit the better days if the place seems more distant. As the pianist sang"We'll be together again," my stomach belched: "not on your life."
As tired as the microwaved sour dough rolls that came with the soup and as careless as the waitress who didn't know what seltzer was, that's today's Max's. Yiddish translation: you could brech from this dreck.
author: Fred  D.

description:
Eat here is the following does not bother you. Or get take out.
For all of this, we were one of two parties in the restaurant.

Called ahead for a reservation for our party. It was a get together after a memorial service. Two separate table with not enough seats. Gestured towards our table with a mumble.
Ordered waters, understanding that it is a drought,  brought half of them. 
Ordered a Moscow mule, got lime water.
Ordered Bud lite, got Bud.
Ordered Tequila with lime, got lemon.
Ordered Avocado fries. They were very thick, breaded, undercooked, no flavour.
We've been waiting now for about 15 minutes to get our order taken....
They sent one plate out of 15 out.
Came back only after we were done eating to check on things.

The food was great! Sliders, Rubens, pasta, all great. 

Back of house is great. Get rid of the front of house and this would be a fantastic place!

Waitress; Alexandra
author: Kaitlyn C.

description: I Enjoy Max"s Opera Cafe When I Attend The Ballet , Or Opera . It's Right Up The Street From City Hall And The Arts Center . The Food Is Delicious And With Generous Portions . Definitely A City Vibe Atmosphere In General. I Highly Recommend Making A Reservation In Advance.
author: Gregory P.

description:
We used to go to the Max's on Third St. in SOMA a lot before it turned into a thai restaurant.  We came to this location since it's somewhat convenient to seeing a show at the Orpheum.  

We came in a large group, so it was good that they have a gigantic menu.  I had the meat loaf, which was my favorite at the other location.  But, it's made quite a bit differently here, and I was very disappointed.  The gravy was not hot, and the meat was bland.  

Some of the others complained about cold food, also.  Convenient location, but lacking in food quality.
author: Dan L.

description:
I would have given 4 stars but the owner no longer accepts the rewards prgm card
(this is the van ness location)
i enjoyed the freshness of their food and their selection is wide and varied.
i ordered take out desserts. i die for their eclair. it practically fills up the plastic container! other faves ares the fruit crumble pie and macarOOns (chocolate, of course).
theyre large so u can prolly share if u have room.
they used to other locations in the city, but the one oin union sq didnt get their lease renewed and the one in embarcadero closes early (2pm ?, m-F only)
author: Keikaikaoakua P.

description: Had not been to a Max's in awhile. Had dinner there last night and the food was good but the service was not up to par. Par to me is paying attention to you as a customer. They need to have more waiters. The restaurants  was very crowded and they only had two waiters. I am not sure I would go back.
author: Diane B.

description:
The food was mediocre but the servers were nice & mimosa delicious. 

Oh and uh... before we left, some servers were crawling all over the floor. Holding cups. Why? 

Baby mice. 

I kinda felt bad since I'm sure chasing mice isn't in their job description but... gross.
author: Jean T.

description:
Max's cafe used to be one of my favorite spots, and when I was under the weather recently the only thing I could think of to make me feel better was the chicken noodle Matzo ball soup.

With the other Max's Cafes mostly gone, this was the closest one I could find. And while the soup was still as I remember, the service and quality was lacking.

I found actual chicken bones in my soup, not just one or two, and a few that I was liable to swallow, but luckily after the first one, I progressed cautiously.

To the restaurant - do not treat this place as some low end establishment, take some pride in the history of Max's and make it to the best of your abilities, don't half ass it, the place is a staple of SF.

This is not the Max's I remember.
author: Jeff B.

description: DO NOT GO HERE BEFORE THE NUTCRACKER. 2 years ago we tried it, and even though we had a reservation, we waited and waited and waited, ate our food in a rush to catch the show. Well, I must have had amnesia because I booked it again yesterday for lunch before the show. We had 12:30 reservations and didn't get seated until 1:15, got our food at 1:30 and had to gulp it down to leave by 1:45 to catch the show on time. And the bill was $135 for 6 people with an included/mandatory 18% gratuity (I did not feel like tipping at this point!). I understand they are very busy, but their system is broken when multiple people with reservations were annoyed and left to find food elsewhere so they could catch the show on time. And what threw me over the edge is that they ended up flat out lying to me, saying our table was paying their bill but we never got that table and then they seated someone with a reservation later than ours before us!! Management needs to do a serious overhaul on reservation/seating practices. Will not be back in future years...
author: Ravi L.

description:
Inedible matzoh  ball soup . Horrible crab cakes and side. Couldn't eat any of it and left -no one cared .
Stay away
author: marilyn b.

description:
My husband's family has been coming here for years and I honestly can't tell you why. The last 2 times we've eaten here before a show it took an hour to get our food. That's on top of the time it took to get someone to take our order. Being that it's "Max's OPERA Cafe" they should be more accommodating to the guests that eat there before shows. 

The food isn't great either. Very inconsistent. I ordered the same thing last 2 times and the first time it was pretty good but the second time it was soooo salty. 

The service is ok. Nothing impressive but not that bad. 

Overall I'd prefer never to come back and I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Samantha G.

description:
Their food and service is quite good, and deserts are excellent.  My wife (Elizabeth B.) loved their corned beef sandwich, and I was absolutely floored by their pork chop, done rare with balsamic vinegar.  

I love rare pork, but I had no idea it could be this good.

Wait. This isn't the one in Palo Alto - but I'll assume there's some carry-over.
author: Eric B.

description:
Best corned beef ruben in town, earning 5 stars. Excellent matzo ball soup, love the russian cabbage as well. Grab clam chowder on Fridays. The Apple Cranberry pie! 

The rest of the menu is a solid 3.5/4. Standard American plates.
author: Alize A.

description:
Just came out of Asian Art Museum & it was prime brunch time.  Sis was hungry & grumpy so we didn't have the luxury of waiting 1.5 hrs for Brenda's Soul Food & she knew Max's would have no line

Well, that's for a reason.....

Sis & the Mr got Huevos Rancheros & were sorely disappointed - they didn't like the scrambled egg aspect - would have preferred over easy - & thought the beans & salsa were super bland

Buddy got the Crabcake Benedict & was likewise unimpressed - the crabcakes were extremely bland

I had originally asked about their "Famous French Toast" but the waitress couldn't tell me if they were custardy or dry.....her response was "It's French Toast".  Gee, how helpful!

So I chose poached eggs w/ country potatoes & a biscuit

Everyone's potatoes were overcooked & crunchy & had that slight undertone of freezer burn

My biscuit was crunchy & the poached eggs were cooked through - no runny yolks

Complete waste of calories & brunch time - but at least we had each other's good company & no line on a busy Easter Weekend.....just be careful what you wish for
author: Adrienne G.

description: It use to be great but they changed owners I guess and it went downhill. Sandwichs are now 17.99 each. Stay away
author: M F.

description: Came here after class to grab a quick bite. I sat at the bar which is very spacious and has lots of seating and grabbed the special margarita and the fried calamari. The fried calamari was sooooo good it was nice and crispy with friend thin slices of lemon mixed amongst the calamari. I like to eat my calamari with a side of marinara the bar staff was more than happy to grab a side for me! Very friendly and welcoming environment too
author: Amber J.

description: Thursday, May 11, 2017:  Went for early dinner with my strawberry shortcake ending on my mind.  I have enjoyed this delight many times, however, tonight I hardly ate any.  The strawberries were not ripe.  They had no taste.  The unripe strawberries made the whole delight turn into a big yuck.  tried to get manager but that person never came.  jmo
author: jerome m.

description:
Ew, I think we hit this Max's on an off-night. Too bad the Corte Madera Max's served its final latke, because I don't know that this spot can replace it in my heart of hearts.

We ordered a green salad with the bacon on the side. They forgot to leave the bacon off: it was served with bacon on the side... and bacon in the salad. Ooops. 

I ordered Max N Cheese, a special, with mushrooms. They forgot to add the cheese: it was served as macaroni noodles drizzled with what looked like watered down Alfredo sauce. Yuck.

The matzo ball soup was good. Not all was lost.

While we waited for our water to return, our table was swarmed with fruit flies. When the waiter arrived and we pointed it out, he told us that they've been waiting for the exterminator all week. Eeek!
author: Dana G.

description:
Two stars?!! Because after an hour we had still not seen our Reuben's and pastramis on rye. The Reuben's were good. The chicken melt was pretty bland acc'ing to my daughter. My wife's Thai tofu salad w soba noodles came without dressing. Nada. 

Maybe just an understaffed night. Or maybe an overrated restaurant. Probably the latter.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I used to love this place. It was my go-to spot in San Francisco for years. This dinner was a real disappointment.

I ordered a NY Strip steak medium rare; it arrived with only the barest pink interior, dry and flavorless. The onion straws that came with it were chewy rather than crisp, and almost as bland as the meat. My companion enjoyed his prime rib, but his baked potato tasted like dirt on the outside. (My potato was salty on the outside, and not quite as thoroughly cooked as I might have liked, but there was no taste of dirt on mine.) 

Despite the usual slowness of the service here, our waiter was eager to please whenever we were actually able to get his attention to ask for something. Still, my companion's dinner included cookies for dessert; the waiter didn't even give me  a chance to order dessert for myself, much less suggest anything. He simply brought the cookies and left post-haste. Similarly, he apologized for the condition of my steak when I mentioned the issue, but didn't offer any suggestions for fixing the problem. 

The live piano in the background was pleasant, but it ended soon after we sat down and didn't begin again while we were there.
author: Kathleen H.

description: Got a pastrami sandwich to go. I was once known to brag about Max's pastrami over others but no more! It was overboiled flavorless non descript meat that I would expect from Subway or Safeway. But actually the pastrami at subway and Safeway tastes better now. Max's I don't know what you have changed but it wasn't a good change at all.
author: Jim L.

description:
Wasn't too terribly impressed. Good eats (Texas Brisket), but nothing to get emotional over. Kinda meh. I'm no foodie but I have had life changing steak. This wasn't that. Like I said, not bad. Just not great either. 

We we there on a pre-opera night. Got there around three. Easy seating. Left a couple hours later (yea, you read that right) and the place was packed. That may explain the minimalist attention our server paid. 

Would I recommend a friend go here to eat? Sure. It just wouldn't be on my "Gotta go there" list.
author: Christopher C.

description: Loved my matzo ball soup, I will go back again just for that. I got the small size and had more than enough. I have the feeling that the food there is made by someone's grandma, which is a great thing because to me seems 'really home made'. Service was fast and attentive and even though is not a super fancy place it has an old charm to it, and I like those lamps that add character to the restaurant. Cozy, comfortable place, not too sophisticated.
author: Carmen V.

description: One of the worse meals I've ever had.  Service was also terrible.   I remember coming here when I first move to SF 15 years ago and it was good.  Not anymore.
author: Maddie W.

description:
I can't believe this place only gets 3 stars!?!

I have eaten here a couple of times and have never left dissatisfied or hungry. (The other location that is now closed - yes! See previous review for the now closed Geary location)

My two favorites thus far are the grilled veggie and artichoke sandwich on a warm ciabatta roll and the Max's Famous Rueben.  Both sandwiches are served with fries and I usually substitute the caesar salad for them, or the sweet potato fries.

The caesar salad comes with kalamata olives and fresh, moist, freshly shaved parmesan  cheese.  You can also add anchovies if that's your thing.

The sweet potato fries speak for themselves (have yet to have a bad sweet potato fry) they are served with some yummy sauce on the side - no need for ranch on these puppies.

Now back to the sandwiches - the veggie is loaded, and I mean loaded with grilled veggies, spinach, onion shoestring fries and has a flavorful balsamic sauce to finish it off!

The Max's famous Reuben is crammed pack with your choice of either pastrami, corned beef or you have the option of having both.  In addition to all that juicy meat you get a mound of sour - sauerkraut!  

Service has been good 90% of the time - so no complaints in that area.

Don't let the low star rating deter you from trying this place.......give it a chance!
author: Heather K.

description: Went here for lunch and I was really impressed by the ambiance. The place looked clean and classy. I ordered the Grandma's Honey-Glazed Chicken and it was pretty good. The chicken was a little bit  dry though. The staff was very nice and friendly and made sure that our water cups were always filled. The portions were really large that we had to take our food home because we couldn't finish it. The place is a bit pricey, but if you got the money to spend and you're nearby, I'd recommend this spot.
author: Randell Kenneth R.

description:
After enjoying a morning concert at the Herbst theater nearby, we were in need of brunch. The yelp app showed the family-friendly places in the theater district were few and far between. Max's was really the only obvious choice, being a mere block away. We made a beeline.

On entering, we discovered we were not alone. The foyer was filled to the brim with waiting families, some on their way to The Nutcracker performance nearby. I sheepishly asked the wait time at the host desk and they said "15 minutes."  Though I was extremely doubtful, I gave them my name, got a pager and sat with the family.  To their word, 15 minutes later we had a nice window table with menus in hand. I was amazed.

My hungry family ordered quickly.  I also opted for coffee and bloody mary (Hey, they were half price!). The coffee was good, and the bloody mary was spot-on; They even rimmed the glass with celery salt. Yum.
 
My huevos rancheros plate was much much better than I expected. It included perfectly-cooked eggs, good beans, guacamole, and home fries. Plus, triple-sized, delicious, homemade tortilla chips were tucked in around the sides. And it wasn't overburdened with cheese, like most places.

I then polled the family on their opinion:
  The oldest daughter: "I love this place!"
  The wife: "mreeymgudmm" (in the middle of enjoying her salad)
  The youngest daughter: "Can we come back here?"

In the end the news was both good and bad. 
The good - we have a decent, family place to eat for the next theater trip. 
The bad - my kids will now expect to always come here whenever we're in the neighborhood.
author: Dan B.

description:
We came here for lunch before heading over to Davies for a show.  I had allocated two hours for lunch, so I figured we should be fine timewise.  But once we got to the front of the line, people with reservations kept jumping to the front of the line ahead of us.  I was getting ready to physically block them from cutting in.  

They asked us if we had a reservation, we didn't.  Then they asked us if we minded eating at the bar, we didn't.  I ordered the lamb burger.  I asked for it well done, it arrived medium to medium rare.  The lamb burger was excellent anyway.  I tried it with some of the sauce on the side, but it tasted better naked.

I really felt sorry for our server/bartender.  One person to handle 10 people eating at the bar simultaneously?  She never checked on us to see how our food was, but did eventually refill our water glasses.  She looked frazzled, and I couldn't blame her.  

Prices are a little on the high side, but the huge portion size makes up for that!
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
Came here on 12/10 with my coworker for lunch and ordered the Chicken Pot Pie.  I had it before so was looking forward to this comfort food on a gloomy day.  When we walked towards the hostess, she was helping another party ahead of us.  When she returned, she had to take a call and didn't acknowledge our presence.  So this waiter Miguel sat us to his station.  BIG MISTAKE already.  He took our order and shortly after brought our drinks.  While we are talking and realized where's the bread they usually provide???  When our food came, we HAD to ask for the bread while other tables around us got their bread without asking.  Miguel came back with our bread...gave one sourdough and one wheat raison...REALLY?  The table behind us was only one person and he got two pieces of bread.  

My pot pie...was very disappointing.  The filling should be like a thick stew but it was VERY RUNNY!  The crust was seem not cooked all the way in the middle.  So I decided to pack the rest...OMG, when I was trying to pack the rest of my pot pie, there was a DEAD COOKED FLY on the side of the crust!!!!!!!!!!  WTF!  I ate half that and didn't realized. I got one of the wait staff and she quickly showed it to Miguel and he brought to their managers or GM's attention.  The GM apologized and said he will comp my meal and drinks and ask if I want anything else...I Said NO.  During our whole meal, NOT once did that Miguel waiter came to see how we are doing and see how our food was.  After the fact that he realized that I was pissed off and he knew his tip was on the line that's when he came around to refill our ice teas.  This placed USED to be good but what the HELL happened?  Save your money and avoid this place.    Poor services, nasty foods...not worth your money.  GO SOME WHERE ELSE!
author: Jan S.

description: Had some amazing desserts and wonderful service amidst lovely jazz music. I hope this place sticks around because it's very special.
author: Camille J.

description: Although I have such fond memories of going to Max's when it really was an "Opera" Cafe, the menu has changed over the years and it didn't seem to be as yummy as I remember it to be. The service was good and the staff was nice. We still took desert home. Hope it is as yummy as we remember it to be!
author: Miki C.

description: Service was great and this place fills up fast!  Make reservations or get there before noon.  I had the Thursday special - turkey, gravy and cranberry sandwich.  It was on non-toasted white bread and had no taste.  The turkey was dry but the gravy and cranberry were good.  I'd probably order something else.  The 4 stars is for the service.
author: Chris L.

description: Ordered their special of the day, a chicken quesadilla.  The "chicken" was that packaged stuff that tasted like chopped gristle held together with some edible binder.  It was just awful.  I've had some good meals here before ((very convenient to the Opera Plaza Cinemas), but if they're using reconstituted foods, I'm outta' there!
author: James W.

description: Worst service ever. Food sucks. DO NOT HAVE AN EVENT HERE. Writing this as I'm in the restaurant. My Grandmother's 73rd birthday. Party of 22. ONE waitress. Got my order wrong. Had to hunt down a waitress myself. Stood by the wait station for 5min. before even being acknowledged. Complained about my order and was recommended by a waitress to speak with a manager. I'm already away from my seat and family and can't even get a waitress/waiter to come to the table. Paid too much for nothing. I'll stop there. Never will ever visit any location again. DONE!!
author: Man M.

description: Generous, reasonably priced portions of comfort food, served by pleasant waitstaff. Piano is a nice touch (the piano player plays Happy Birthday!). Plus, some of the wait staff are singers, and they'll get up and sing. Convenient if you're going to opera/ballet/symphony.
author: Heres J.

description:
A surprisingly good choice for brunch. You'll be surrounded by old folks but they are all definitely harmless. The food is delicious if a tad on the higher side but each dish is MORE than enough for more one person!

Ask for extra free bread if you want. 

USEFUL TIP: Buy the gift cards from Costco if you plan on coming back. You'll save 25% off!
author: Joshua L.

description:
Been eating here on rare occasions for many years. We've also been to the ones in Burlingame and Palo Alto.

This is certainly not a place that I would highly recommend but the only time we suffered some dissatisfaction (Burligame) a kind compensation was made.

We had the crab cakes and chicken piccata. Each was just fine, not exceptional. The portions were generous enough to feel full satisfaction.

There was no singing during our visit but the piano player made for pleasant listening.
author: Swing C.

description: not worth the money.  pretty lousy cut of meat.  very good service.  won't be going back
author: Robert S.

description: Max's always had a strong place in my heart.   Ive been coming here for years, with family on special occasions, and many dates and good memories.    But its changed.   Th waiters used to sing... there was a life pianist... the food was HUGE and came out fast, and the staff... was very friendly and literate.   But its changed.    I still wanna go there... all the time... But then I reconsider every time now and pick a different place...  cause i know I will be disappointed again.    I love you Max's... and 20 years ago you were 5-Stars, 10-Years ago you were 4-Stars... and today it breaks my heart to give you a 3 star review after our 30 year relationship.    The giant nachos are all that keep you from being a 2-Star place now... cause the price point vs. quantity vs. quality... and unsmiling staff... its tough to see a place that was so consistent and rooted in SF tradition... fall by the wayside, and be a shadow of its former self.    I'm not ready to write you off yet Max... I may have one or two visits left in me... and if i have a better overall experience ... then I will gladly edit this review.
author: Vlad C.

description: Really good food in a nice spot. The prices are kinda high, but you also can find fair prices on alot. However its a nice restaurant so I don't mind paying a little more if I get good food and service, which i did. I got the Tuesday special which is a mojito steak sandwich-mint, lime, and rum glaze, soo good. I don't really like mint or lime foods but you cant taste either specifically but it makes the glaze really tasty.
author: B C.

description:
My wife and I ate here after a concert and dance program on Sunday November 15.  We ordered a corn beef on rye and a pastrami on rye sandwiches.  Both sandwiches were poor.  The corn beef and pastrami had no flavor and must have been sitting on the steam table for many hours.  Service was poor and my wife found the ladies room to be a mess. We have eaten here many times in the past but have noticed that Max's has changed in the last year or two and not for the better!   Needless to say we will not go to Max's again.

If you want a good corn beef or pastrami sandwiches you should go to Miller's East Coast Deli on Polk.  We discovered this eatery two years ago and recommend it.  It is further from Davies and the opera house but well worth the walk.
author: Art K.

description: The food at this establishment is overly salty the decor is a very nice the waiters were very nice but the absolute saltiness of the food was just disgusting!!! I ordered the burger malt with Fry's and my aunt were the same thing it was as if you hey just dumped salt all over the burger and frys while I was eating the food my lip was burning maybe this was just my experience personally but I would caution anybody going here
author: Ray K.

description: We've been here a few times when we vist SF....my Dad, who lives in SF loves it. Delicious food, friendly staff....but the best part? Dessert! The brownie sundae was spectacular!!
author: Meredith C.

description:
It saddens me that I've eaten lunch here so many times, but it is super convenient to the courthouse.  The food is average and overpriced, and the service is hit or miss.

Nothing here really stands out, but my standby is the soup-salad combo with the matzo ball soup and the caesar salad.  The soup sometimes has a ton of chicken and is sometimes pretty sparse.  The matzo ball is average in texture and flavor.  The salad isn't swimming in dressing, which is nice.  Other dishes that are decent but unexciting include the turkey dinner, and the pastrami and eggs.  The latkes have a bit of an odd texture and weren't flavorful enough for me.  Make sure to ask for extra apple sauce if you order them.
author: Chris C.

description:
Walking into Max's I felt dwarfed by the gynormous cakes and heart stopping comfort food. This is the place where you come for a BIG eat.

Located a stone's throw from City Hall, the ballet, symphony and movie theater (at Opera Plaza), it's a great place to stop in for a bite or a snack.

For this visit, I enjoyed the Roasted Veggie Wrap ~ a spinach tortilla wrap with caramelized onions, roasted peppers, portobello mushrooms, avocado, feta cheese, hummus, and fresh spinach. It comes with a tasty side salad of fresh corn, arugula, red onions, and tomatoes, lightly dressed. If you come by later in the evening, they have a tendency to run out of certain items. We opted for the apple pie and chuckled as a flyer saucer of a pie landed on our table. I'd forgotten that Max's does it BIG. It was a tad dry, heavy on the crust and encrusted with sugar. The bright side is that I didn't chow it all down, so I've another meal for tomorrow.

The service is friendly. They have a pianist depending on the time of day and sometimes the servers will sing a jaunty tune. A treat for the the ears and for the belly.

PS: If you want to plan ahead, here's their sample menu:

http://www.maxsattheopera.com/id1.html
author: Cathy K.

description:
Great place to come for weekend brunch!  The restaurant is very spacious and has a very comfortable atmosphere.  The service is excellent and the food was very enjoyable.

My vegetarian frittata was delicious!  I was able to substitute the potatoes for fruit and biscuit for toast without being charged extra.  The portions are huge and I was only able to finish half my dish.  The best part of our meal was the bread basket.  The bread basket included fresh sourdough and cinnamon raisin rolls.  They were SO good.  Our server was very helpful and attentive.  The prices are very reasonable.  The location is conveniently located near City Hall and many of the performance halls.  I will definitely be coming back!
author: Angela F.

description: had brunch there on 8/12.  sadly the place has really deteriorated.  sat in one of the booths, the table was so sticky that my arms stuck to it.  badly understaffed the one waiter i saw was running around like crazy trying to help customers, more showed up around 12 but still service was bad.  the food was really bad.  had the house hash with eggs, turned out to be scrambled eggs with chopped ham, nothing like any hash i had ever had before.  the potatoes were very strange, some were nice and hot while others were icy cold.  having eaten there before i was surprised at how things were and hope it was a one time only but it will be a while before i go back if ever.
author: Roger R.

description: What to do when you're hungry and you're heading to watch a movie at the Opera Plaza Cinema?  Stop in on Max's Opera Cafe, of course!  Portions were huge, decor and ambiance was reminiscent of a diner in NYC, and there was a lovely pianist playing.  I had the matzo ball soup and the Greek mezze plate.  If I were Jewish, I'd imagine that this is what my mom's matzo ball soup would've tasted like growing up.  It was a bowl of comfort.  The mezze platter had a great hummus and tzatziki.  The hummus was fresh and tasted like it had never been refrigerated, as is should taste.  All in all, if you're looking for comfort and the taste of home, eat at Max's.
author: Diana A.

description: Great lamb burger.  Service sucks.  I'm the customer for crying out loud and you want my money - earn it or go out of business.
author: Edward V.

description: the service was unbearably slow and the waiters were unfriendly. i will never come back here ever again i cant believe a place like this is even in service i am pyst!!!!!
author: Megan I.

description:
I have coming to this location for over
30 yrs.  never have I been so disappointed 
In the food than I had last nite. Nothing
Like the quality of food and service as it
Was.  I know Mr. Berkowitz is no longer
Associated with this restaurant, but
To serve food without any flavor, seasonings, water downed soup nor
presentation is very unappetizing.
author: Irene D.

description: Our family of four went there for dinner after seeing Star Wars.  We have been going for over 25 years as it is so convenient to the AMC 1000 and has been a family favorite.  We were all surprised that the menu has totally changed.  It just feels like there is new management and not for the better.  There used to be waiter/performers but not the night we went.  It has always been on the expensive side but with large portions that kind of justified the price.  Now the sandwiches are large but also $17-$18.  I had the Chinese chicken salad which didn't match the menu description (no peanuts as indicated) and the chicken was way overcooked.  Fries were not great, which they used to be, and most of the food was just average.
author: Teri S.

description: I've been coming here for years. I haven't been in a long time, got the matzo ball soup, AMAZING! I got the bowl and it wasn't big enough!! I wanted more. The latkes are always good with apple sauce and sour cream. And the chocolate cake is to die for! I am not a huge chocolate cake freak but you really need to get it at Max's, it's the perfect chocolate cake!
author: Karen T.

description: Do yourself a favor! Stay away from this nasty place!  I used to order a plain Cesar salad 3 times out the week.  Well, I guess the girl got tired of me coming and the last time I ordered and picked up the Cesar salad, she smile as she handed me the bag.  I though hmm.. she never smile like that before?  I got deadly sick!! I had to take off work.  This place customer service and food cleanliness is on a case by case basis. You may get good service and food.. depending on the day and person. Your best bet is don't waste your time or dime!
author: Lynnette W.

description: Absolutely the worst phone service ever. Tried to order a cake three times for my boss' birthday today, but ladies kept hanging up on me and giving me two different opinions of what cakes they do and don't have. Too bad their cakes look so awesome, I guess they never want anyone to enjoy them.
author: Yvonna C.

description:
Service, food, and drinks were awful. I was in a group  and not one person's dish was okay. Worst part was the service. After they dropped off the food, no one came to see if the meal was okay or if there was anything wrong. I sat trying to wave the waitress down for quite some time before I finally asked the people next to me to get up from their seat so I could track the waitress down (we were in a booth so we all had to get up). When I finally told her my order was wrong, she said I ate too much of the food to do anything. Funny since I could barely eat it. 

The drinks were weak and tasted like cheap alcohol. Someone in my group ordered vegetable pasta and actually stopped eating after a few bites because it was so awful. 

I was going to just forget everything and still tip decently despite the rude attitude but the waitress didn't even bother to return my card! She just gave me the receipts but kept my card! Ridiculous. 

I tipped poorly to the waitress, something I've never done before but was close to not tipping at all.
author: Grace L.

description:
I really like Max's. Usually great service and tasty food. However, the service for the takeout counter is so inconsistent. This location is right by city hall and the opera. They are always busy for dinner and moderately for lunch. Unfortunately, the takeout staff do not seem to be trained with exceptional customer service like the actual servers. 
I went on the 21st. Ordered two chicken Cesar wraps and it was a disaster. The receipt I received only says "PM takeout", no name. So I cannot reference a name. Anyhow, I've never experienced this level of rudeness and poor customer service here ever! The guy made such an easy order complicated. First of all, he tried twice to charge me for salads and then couldn't understand that I asked for no dressing inside the wrap. Rudely, he would try to confirm my order and when he finally got it right he didn't apologize. 
The first wrap was completed in 5minutes but I waited almost 20 minutes for the second. Mind you, there were no customers before me and he did not have to take any orders while mine should've been completed. My order being that it were the wraps, he makes them at the counter in front of customers. While waiting, I could see he kept leaving the station to make my order. Looked like he kept go no into the kitchen. Every time he left with his gloves on and returned without gloves. Mentioned something about waiting for more chicken. Fine but while I'm waiting he should apologize for the wait and ask if I needed something to drink. Neither happened which in my opinion is unnecessary incompetence. You know most people don't want to believe restaurants "tamper" or grossly handle their food but by his incompetence and rude demeanor, I wouldn't be surprised if every time he left, he was doing something to my order. By the time I received the complete order the first wrap was cold, of course. They were sloppily made and fell apart. I refused to eat it keeping in mind my experience. 

I enjoy the customer service from dining in and the takeout unfortunately I'll have to pass.
author: Ms. F.

description:
We were there Friday night and they were very nice. The place was packed but they took care of us on a timely manner. The hostess was very friendly and nice while we were waiting. 
The servers were helpful and helped us choosing since it was our first time there. It did take a little bit to get the food but since they were busy it was understandable. 
Overall we liked the place and the food
author: Ana A.

description: Great service!! Food is amazing.. A great place to max and relax. I would recommend this to anyone in San Fran
author: Juan S.

description: I have gone to this restaurant many times over the 30+ years it has been around. It offers comfort food (including deli food) with large portions, and reasonable prices. The quality has slipped on some items (largely due to new recipes, which were not an improvement, the pot roast being one example). Some of the items I like are the bistro salad, the matzot ball soup, the Russian cabbage soup, the latkes, and the sandwiches (esp. corned beef, pastrami, and burgers). Very good service, and comfortable atmosphere.
author: Jethro B.

description:
In February 2009 I gave Max's two stars.  Unfortunately I didn't read my own review and went back.  Huge mistake!  I really wish I could leave no stars.

This used to be my default place around City Hall.  No more!

Our waiter clearly didn't understand her job and kept asking for clarification.  Perhaps if she had taken 5 minutes to familiarize herself with the menu she'd know what's on there.

I ordered a hot pastrami sandwich.  What I got was cold brisket sandwich.  I asked for it to be heated and for all the drama displayed it would you make you think I was asking to see the cow before it was slaughtered.  What came back was a cold sandwich.  Again.

The pickle came out of a jar (I saw the Vlasic jar in the service area).  We had to ask (when we could find a server) for mustard..  No one came and checked on us, even though we wanted to order more.

In general this is a poor excuse for a restaurant and especially one that serves a particular kind of food.  It seems like maybe they've sold to someone else but the original owners (if they can tear themselves away from counting their money) should check and see what a pitiful excuse for a restaurant  Max's has become.

Save yourself money and taste buds - go to the McDonald's across the street.  You'll save time and money and really the food couldn't be any worse.
author: Stitch H.

description: Big portions and OK food.  Those are the big things that come to mind when I think of this place.  The food is pretty basic.  Service is pretty good here if that's a concern.
author: Eric F.

description:
I used to come here before or after symphony, ballet, opera and really thought the food was great. However, last night we ate here before the ballet, and it was an epic fail.
I asked the waitress about an item on the menu "bricked chicken and garlic confit" and she was clueless, saying it was a baked half chicken with some garlic. She didn't know what confit meant for this dish and didn't offer to find out.

So I ordered the chicken piccata. It was AWFUL. It was FRIED, like coated with something and FRIED. It did not mention "fried" on the menu. I would never have ordered it if it did. And: It was overcooked, dry and chewy. The sauce, which is supposed to be lemony, was pretty tasteless except for the capers. I couldn't eat it.

The wild rice pilaf might have been tasty if it weren't so super salty. I could barely eat it.

The sautéed spinach (I love spinach) was so bitter that I literally couldn't eat it. 

My friend ordered the same thing. We both left most of the food on our plates and basically ate bread for dinner. The Acacia Pinot Noir was good. Ha.

This dinner was a complete bomb. And it cost me $50. Maybe I need to stick with pastrami sandwiches and chopped liver? I don't know. But I won't be going back any time soon!
author: Janet D.

description:
My family met here before going to see a performance of the Nutcracker.  The location is perfect (we parked underground and walked to the War Memorial Opera House). We walked in, with reservations, and were seated right away. 

The food was very good.  We ordered everything from Chicken Marsala to Chicken Tacos to a variety of salads.  Timing of the food was a little off (the dinner salads came with the entree, rather than beforehand) but everyone was happy with their meal. The servers were terrific - they took our orders on a timely basis and kept our way glasses filled).

The only reason I give the place three stars is that it is simply too noisy.  It is nearly impossible to carry on a conversation with anybody across the table.  We sat near the piano and when the pianist started playing, the sound level just went up.
author: Darlene C.

description:
This place is overpriced, has terrible service and honestly doesn't deserve to be in business. On a night when ballet starts at 7:30, why is there 1 bartender for entire bar area AND entire restaurant? Why is there one server for 15 tables? It takes 40 minutes to be seated and order.
This tastes like fast food, but it's not. Huge fail. Never again.
author: Emily B.

description: Had a reservations at this restaurant and waited an hour without even getting our meal. Nobody at the restaurant seem to be concerned, nobody wanted to accommodate us.  We were sitting there watching other people around us get served.  We finally had to get up and walk out of the restaurant. We got no apologies, nothing from the management of the server on our way out.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anybody who is planning on going to a performance at either the symphony hall or the opera house. This restaurant has been in this location for long enough to understand the volume of business required on Friday before performances and plan and be prepared for it. They weren't and They didn't care.
author: Rob J.

description:
I love the fun food they have. It's a good and bad place to eat while you're on a diet.
I eat there at least once a month and love it!
author: Karen S.

description:
Ever since they opened here, one could always get decent sandwiches and pretty good desserts ( Although this is the place where, in the 80's, I heard a gentleman customer in a tux ask the waiter, "Is this called New York Cheesecake because that is where the refrigerator came from?", referring to the stale taste that comes from long storage in the fridge. ) even though the rye for the sandwiches were marbled.

Well, a recent visit was disappointing on almost every count: chopped liver, corned beef, pastrami, at al. I have no idea what happened, but almost every worker there were grumpy, unlike before.

Perhaps it was just a bad day, or perhaps my taste buds have changed.
author: George T.

description: I did not like the food. At least the dish I got was terrible. It is also priced high and does not justify the cost. Service is really bad too.
author: Mudit G.

description: Held our office's holiday party here for 100 people. At first, seeing the very mixed reviews here on Yelp made me feel a lot of trepidation as part of the holiday planning committee. But we choose the venue for it's convenient location. It ended up being a huge success! This place was beautifully decorated for the holidays (snowflakes, Christmas decor etc adorned the ceilings), the food was very affordable ($20/pp average cost for buffet style food including salmon, chicken, vegetarian options, salads, and desserts), open cash bar was efficient and cheap, waiters were very responsive in getting our drinks, and the food was surprisingly delicious and fresh tasting. The best part was that we were able to rent a live pianist which gave the party a festive, classy vibe for a super low price. Pianist ended up being very talented and even played requested songs and allowed some of us to karaoke. I really have to recommend this place for office parties now.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Just a few years ago, I loved Max's.  Combination of tasty pastrami sandwiches and opera singing waiters was amazing. Two nights ago, however, I decided to try the restaurant again, just before the symphony.  I made a BIG mistake by ordering something other than the usual deli food---a shrimp louis salad.  It looked good.  Nice big shrimp on a bed of vegetables, with the classic "louis" or thousand island dressing. The taste, however, was what you would expect to find in a Bakersfield Applebees.  To begin with, the shrimp were tough, woody and not completely thawed out.  I couldn't believe the icy center of each cardboard-like shrimp, so I offered one to my business colleague, and he found the icy heart of the shrimp to be equally nasty.  The vegetables tasted like they came out of those hermetically sealed plastic bags, where they have been lingering for months.  I assume the sandwiches and burgers are still good.  Stick with them!  And the pianist (no opera singers this time) was excellent.
author: Norman R.

description:
I usually come here for lunch when I'm running errands near civic center, but today the service was so exceptionally bad I don't plan on ever coming back.

I sat at the bar and ordered a bloody mary, the bartender, an older woman with wavy red dyed hair and a terrible attitude took my order then walked away to go chat with her friends/regulars at the end of the bar. After being there for 10 minutes she finally came back and I had to reorder my drink. I also ordered their Thursday lunch special, a hot turkey sandwich, but when my food arrived it was a pastrami sandwich.  The bartender set it down then walked away, never checking back or even glancing in my direction.  

I finally got her attention when she came back to drink a beverage she had prepared for herself and left right in front of my food. I explained the mistake and she tried to tell me that I ordered incorrectly.

 When the dish came out she again never checked back on me, but yet she managed to find time to take away the mustards before I was finished eating. 

When I asked for the check she slapped it down,  not exaggerating, she slapped my check down as though I were someone she despised, and without so much as a thank you or goodbye she walked back to chat with her friends.  She made me feel uncomfortable and unwelcome, I couldn't taste my food just her bitter attitude.
author: Caitlin S.

description:
Ate lunch today at the bar. The menu was limited to sandwiches and salads only, no grill items. Major disappointment, as my entire point of going was for a patty melt and fries. 
The bartender was unfriendly and lacked a social personality, which is typically an automatic requirement for a bartender. She spoke entirely in Spanish when talking with coworkers, which is unprofessional and rude to guests. The salad was practically unpalatable without a heap of dressing to mask the sour greens. Major disappointment.
author: A A.

description:
Always excellent food and service.  Try the half-pastrami, half-corned beef.

An SF mainstay!
author: John T.

description:
Food was excellent. Service from bar was SLOW. Wonderful music while I ate my dinner. Hostess and staff please move it up a notch. Dress accordingly and drink some caffeine to 
move it into gear. This has been a family tradition to eat here before Ballets and Symphonies. You have the BEST location now perform to that.
author: Katrena M.

description: We ate here before going to the opera to see Show Boat.  The food was "okay" - but nothing to rave about.  Mostly, it is a zoo to watch elderly people eating their food.  The table next to us sported an unhappy customer who demanded to see the manager to complain about the waiter's ability to service his table.  The place was very crowded and the waiters were literally running with food to service the tables.  I thought about how the wait staff must hate "Opera Night" to see all these grouchy old people come in complaining and demanding because they never get out and because they get shocked at the prices of the food.  This, of course, has little to do with Max's Opera Cafe - but if you like watching old rich people act foolish, this might be just the place you want to go.
author: Steve S.

description: Typical american restaurant that should not be located in San Francisco. I ordered the Pastrami sandwich. It was mediocre. The cole slaw was off. My wife had the chicken marsala and mashed potatoes and ended up getting it packaged and we gave it to a homeless person and not sure they would appreciate it? Our other guest had the burger and ate 1/4th of it and took it home to hopefully make it better for a future meal. Dont go here. There are tons of better restaurants in SF. But if you like boring American bland food and piano music with an opera singer then it might be your place. Music was loud and as bland as the food.
author: T. P.

description: Yesterday I held an event for a group of 30 people at Max's Opera Cafe, and although the food was yummy, the service left behind a nasty taste. I diligently provided, in advance, I might add, all the information necessary for creating a smooth event, but it was far from it. Someone dropped the ball, and then some. Conveniently, there was no onsite manager to boot.  As a result, the event felt like a chaotic mess. To make matters worse, the waiter assigned to our group was smarmy and a smart-aleck.  One attendee commented, "never again". Okay, so let's give credit where credit is due...aside from the tasty food, there was one other high note.  I give 5 stars to the event manager I worked with prior to the event. Too bad he was on vacation the day of.  :(  Funny how bad service can ruin a perfectly good meal and event.
author: Mikki S.

description:
I had the grilled salmon salad with quinoa and arugula. So, they get points for having a gluten-free option. The salmon was cooked just right: not underdone and still juicy, not dry. 
The service was fast and friendly. I wanted a list of vodka options for my martini, and my host (an attorney familiar with the restaurant) needed a steak knife for his pork chop. Both were fulfilled within a reasonable wait, though my martini was a tad on the diluted side, flat instead of crisp and sharp. But, I would have no problem going back again.
author: James S.

description:
What a horrible place. I had eaten here and it is not very good but we had dinner with the family on Sunday and it was DISGUSTING. They brought out a turkey burger that was not cook and refused to cook it, had to send food back and forth quite a few time to get even close to what we orders. My kid was saying dad this is terrible do I have to eat it. The other kid order Mac and Cheese and did not even touch her dish since it was so horrible. 
It ruined a great show we saw at the opera house. 
Worst restaurant experience I have had in a long time
author: Rocker 1.

description: I and my husband and friends have enjoyed eating at the Sam Francisco location for many years.. The ambiance is beautiful and the seating is comfortable and after 6 PM, a wonderful piano player plays enjoyable music. At times, the wait staff sings while we are enjoying our meals. The food and drinks are tasty and the bar is beautiful and the drinks are very well made. Recently, we visited on a Saturday evening and Gary was an excellent waiter. We went the following day , on Sunday, and we felt badly for a different wait staff, since he clearly needed help because he had too many tables to provide adequate service. My friend mentioned this to the manager, who said, "I know." We noticed that we had to ask other staff to give us more coffee, water, to pay the bill, order desert. The wait staff did his best to serve us but we could see that he could not handle so many tables. The management needs to be more supportive. This is the reason the review does not have 5 stars.
author: Donna C.

description:
I am not sure what was worse; the BO from the server or the food.

The Grilled Chicken Cobb had yesterday's lettuce, the cheese on the Burger was not melted and the Maxaroni and Cheese was cold.
author: Bogee B.

description:
Not sure what happened to Maxs Opera Cafe it is slowly going downhill since changing ownership.


We were given a two sided Menu, I asked what happened to the old menu, we consolidated it to a two sided menu..most items are still there,  I don't think so.

A friend was in town so we decided to go eat there.  We decided to split a pastrami sandwich and each get a bowl of Gumbo.  I asked the waiter if he could have it plated separately, he said that would be a extra $3.50... My jaw dropped.

Then the soup arrived I asked for crackers he said they didn't have any but would bring some Matzo crackers.  He returned to the table and said we don't have any,!  Is this a restaurant or school Cafeteria?

Now to the most important part of the sandwich...the Pickle..it now longer the big fat juicy pickles that make Max's but was a limp no taste pickle.

Sorry Max's you,lost a. Longtime customer
author: Ricky B.

description: I can no longer recommend this place for food. It must be under new management, as the quality has deteriorated seriously. Crab cakes for $18 offered two medium size patties with a lovely golden finish but no crab flakes whatsoever. The inside was wet and creamy without a crab taste or any taste except the heavy tartar sauce plopped on top. Don't order a mixed drink here, as their specialty drinks taste pre-mixed. Stick to wine or beer.
author: Patricia F.

description:
The service and food here has gone seriously downhill. Totally inept service with missed orders and the formerly ok food is now akin to Denny's at twice the price. I've been coming here before the opera for years but I don't think I'm coming back.
Although they were busy I don't think that's an excuse for the experience I had. They didn't set the table so I had to improvise my rolls and butter...I ordered sides that never came but which they billed me for. My salad was elderly, the chicken dry and cold....no water and no offers of refills on drinks. In fact I never saw my server until she reappeared with the, incorrect, bill.
author: Ted S.

description: Went there after seeing a movie at Landmark Theater in Nov. The fish tastes good and the servings are quite large. Some staff played piano there and the soft music contributed to a quiet atmosphere, while some staff and guests talked a little loud.
author: Laura D.

description: Another old friend in the feed-my-face business. Before there was a chain, there was Max's Opera Cafe. We haven't been here in some time, and ended up seeing the symphony that evening with friends. Not much has changed - busy, happy, expert staff and some familiar faces behind the bar. I would have typically rated this as a three star location in terms of the wow-food factor, but for whatever reason the comfort food here simply tastes better. The chain spin offs are simply not the same, which is a great thing. My deal is the pastrami ruben and the matzah ball soup - such a great combo. True to form, we never get a chance to sample the hugely portioned desserts, cause' we're full after dinner.
author: Art H.

description:
Usually crowded every time I've been there, with a line outside, day and night, of people waiting to get in.

The sandwiches and salads there are very good, but not exceptional.  The soups I've tried have been very good.  But, in my opinion, you don't go to Max's Cafe at the Opera for a 5-star meal:  you go there for the excellent, outrageous, and absolutely decadent deserts.

The serving staff sing a cappella a wide variety of classical opera samples and the deserts well worth the long wait, if any, to get a table.
author: Thomas H.

description: Man this is a very good place to eat the food is great and the service 5 stars you have to try the deserts amazing;) I love this place..
author: Miguel L.

description:
I love the nice size chilled martinis and always, until recently, REALLY ENJOYED the roasted beet salad which was and is DELICIOUS!   However the other day I tried their Chinese chicken salad and I can't believe they let the dressing that comes with this salad ever get out of the kitchen!  Fortunately I ordered it on the side so I only ruined a few bites of the salad till got another dressing.  I hope the waiter told the kitchen of reaction but in case they don't change it, I suggest you taste it first...or go with the beets. 
So ONE START FOR THAT DRESSING BUT 5 FOR THE BEETS !
..
author: Julia L.

description:
They do give you some bread and butter at the start of you're meal.

They do have a gluten free menu. I had chicken piccata it was good. It needed salt and pepper though. I give them props for making real mashed potato's. 

The waiter kept asking us if we wanted drinks. We declined many times. I know why so they can make more money that way. We just wanted ice water. They never asked us if we wanted a refill. 

I didn't like the way they were rushing me at the table. Taking my empty plate away really fast. 

This location seems to be pretty pricey then the Palo Alto location. I shouldn't have to pay so much for pasta with some type of protein. Palo Alto charges $3.00 for chicken this location charges $5.00 if you want chicken in you're pasta. I don't want to have to pay close to $20.00 dollars for a pasta dish. So stick to the regular meals instead. You will get more bang for you're buck.
author: Linda N.

description:
What I Ate
- Caesar salad (no anchovies!)
- Max n Cheese (September special--lots of different cheeses, bacon, and bread crumbs)
- Niagra Falls cake

Would I Go Again?
My wife and I met my in-laws at Max's before heading over to see the San Francisco Symphony.  The location is great, especially if you are planning to see a show later that night.  For better of worse, Max's has great windows that look out onto Van Ness.  During dinner, we were treated to a biker coalition that included many nude riders.  One word.  Ouch!

The food was very enjoyable.  The caesar salad was standard--nothing special.  I did appreciate that the quantity of caesar dressing was held in check.  The Max n Cheese was great.  The different cheeses and flavorings, along with the bacon and bread crumbs, created a both tasty and fancy macaroni and cheese dish.  My only recommendation would be to increase the volume of cheese, bacon, etc. and decrease the volume of pasta.  The cheese, bacon, and bread crumbs were just that good!

Finally, the cake.  My in-laws have been talking about this cake since I joined the family, so my first bite brought years of anticipation along with it.  I will say this--it was very good.  The cake was moist, the ganache was rich, and the buttercream frosting was light.  Add a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and it was quite the dessert.  Now, with that said, I am not ready to crown this chocolate cake as my favorite.  I would currently place it number three, behind Magleby's chocolate cake and PF Chang's Great Wall of Chocolate.  

Overall, I had a great experience at Max's and would happily return.
author: Ben M.

description:
Something has definitely happened at Max's over the past year (new chef? new management?) My family and I went there for lunch yesterday and the food was bad, really, really bad.

I had a tuna salad sandwich and the tuna had a strange, sweet taste to it. Not at all what good Jewish deli tuna usually tastes like. The rye bread wasn't soft at all and the fries that came with it were overcooked. My daughter had the french toast and it was completely inedible because it was DRENCHED in butter (and we like butter) and was just gross. Finally, the Russian cabbage soup was a huge disappointment - again, way, way too sweet. 

Our server was nice enough but still, ugh. Max's isn't cheap but I didn't used to mind paying for it because the food was actually good but ick, no more.
author: Suzanne L.

description:
Pretty much everything I've had there is quite good, with the exception of the salmon burger, which is marginal.  And the portions tend to be pretty big, though the reubens seem to be getting smaller of late.  

The biggest problem is that food can be slow coming out, even when the restaurant isn't particularly crowded.  Otherwise, recommended.
author: Robert L.

description:
I have been a customer of Max's since they first opened. I had not been there for some time, and recently went for the first time in a long while. I was dismayed to find the menu greatly reduced, the quality of the food diminished, and the surroundings run down.

It is no longer the same place. It used to be a campy, trendy, flashy diner. Now it is more of a run down, and declining enterprise with a mediocre product.
author: Joe B.

description:
The Story of the Time I Got Carded in the Rudest Way:

I volunteer every wednesday at PJOH (holla!) and last wednesday, two of my co volunteers who are serving as pseudo moms pleasantly decided to take me here for a drink. 

As we approached the bar, the bartender asked THEM (in a rather unpleasant and demanding fashion) "Is she (meaning me) over 21?"

...... I'm sorry, what that implies is 1. I'm obviously underage and if thats so, 2. I can't speak for myself and should let the "adults" handle the conversation.

Well... 1. I'm 23. 

and 2. I don't ever recall being treated like that as a child. I'm pretty sure at 6 the people at Starbucks were kind enough to ask me personally if I wanted whip cream in my hot chocolate. 

So I spoke up and said, "Yes. I am, would you like to see my ID?" (Which I already had ready to present to him because I AM AWARE I LOOK 18)

He was caught off guard that words were coming from my mouth (because he hadn't addressed his question to me) and said, still in a demanding tone, Yes. Then we calmly discussed how I look 18, but am actually 23. My pseudo moms told me to be happy I'll look 21 at 35, which I will be. But I'm hopeful people have the decency to actually address me and not the other people I am with.  Oh wait, 99.9% of the time, they already do.

I worked in a bar before, I understand under 21's can't sit at the bar, but to pull some sort of stunt like that before we even sat down left a very bad taste in my mouth. There are ways to approach situations that are more pleasing to the customer and ensures you don't anger them to the point of no return.

The wine I had wasn't that great. It's overpriced here and at the airport. After this stunning display I will certainly never be back.
author: Emily D.

description: We were seated immediately and given menus by the host.  We waited half an hour for a server to acknowledge us and take our order, but none came and we left.
author: GARY B.

description: This place has really deteriorated.  We have been going there for 25 years or more, but it has been about two years since our last visit because of our move from the Bay Area.  It was abominable.  We arrived at 5:30 well before the opera.  It went bad immediately.  It took at least 10 minutes to simply get a wine bucket for our wine that we brought.  We had to ask twice.  Service was slow even though they were not busy. The ahi appetizer dressing had too much mayonnaise detracting from its flavor.  When the entrees finally arrived, my French fries and Pastrami were lukewarm.  I told the server who took it back.   My wife's Cobb salad arrived 10 minutes later after we again reminded the server.  When my Ruben was brought back, the fries were warm, but the sandwich was unchanged and cold.  I asked for the manager who came over.  I explained the service problems to that point and  asked for a new sandwich.  My wife's salad was mediocre.  The lettuce was mostly iceberg, tired and not chilled.  It came with below average blue cheese dressing.  Only the chicken breast was adequate.  Our friend's salmon was overcooked.   The rice was served on the plate from a scoop.  They made no effort to even adjust the mound for presentation.  A new sandwich was brought.  It had too much thousand island dressing and too little sauerkraut.  The Pastrami portion was small, thinly cut (not New York style) and over grilled.  Again mediocre.  It was not until half way through the opera that I learned that the meat was obviously bad.  Overall, an exceptionally  poor experience.  The worst dinner at an Open table restaurant that had been a good convenient restaurant to the War Memorial Opera house and Davies Symphony Hall.  Avoid it.  It is obvious they no longer care.
author: Susan R.

description:
We had our sites set on dessert and Max's turned out be an A+ choice.  The location is perfect, right on the corner of Geary and Van Ness Ave in the City.  Everything looked scrumptious on the menu.  The fries are hand cut and the burgers also looked divine.  The place was bumpin' with a crowd of twenty-and thirty somethings.  There were two tables of people from Germany and France surrounding us (I always enjoy picking out familiar phrases from the days when I studied French!).  

There's nothing like a huge crock of cranberry apple cobbler to mask the oily, slimy film of fatty pho (big mistake choosing to dine in China town beforehand...).  The desserts were absolutely phenomenal.  The hot-fudge sundae is spot on, as are the pies.  Want something to go?  Grab a full size pumpkin pie for around $12.95.   What a deal!  They are also no-sugar added options for the health-conscious individual like myself.  

But, I was on vacation and wanted to splurge.  This cobbler was out of a dream.  The ratio between crust and filling was prime, and the scoop of vanilla ice cream on top added just the right amount of creaminess to balance the cranberries' tartness.  I could go on forever about this treat.  The service could have been a little swifter, but I wasn't in a rush.  Another hit in the heart of the city.
author: Sarah K.

description:
The last time I was there, I didn't care for it. I gave it another chance now that I work in S.F. again, YUM! They've totally renovated the inside and decor so it looks a lot better. Their portions are HUGE like Cheesecake Factory's. I only ordered the burger at lunch time and the loved the huge steak fries. 

Will be coming back again.
author: Jennifer J.

description: Came over to this diner after a nice ballet matinee with a friend and our girls. We were  for a pleasant meal. First off, our water had no ice and after a few minutes was lukewarm. Unfortunately service was slow and our waitress did not pay attention to us at all. I ordered Prosecco and she forgot but didn't apologize, she merely looked the other way as it came after asking her twice and 20 minutes later. Food was flavorless. We probably won't come again!
author: Sharlyn B.

description: I had ordered the buffalo chicken wings and the jambalaya pasta. The bleu cheese dressing was missing in the chicken wings and it wasn't coated in buffalo sauce either.  There wasn't any chicken in the pasta despite it being written in the menu description. This was a take out order. The pasta was average and not worth the money.
author: BlueStar V.

description: There was TWO MOUSES under r table and are food took almost an hour and it was finally cold, they changed r table because of the mouse but nothing was compensated no manager came to apologize or try to catch the mouse would never go there again
author: Mony K.

description: Great location with the theaters and symphony right down the road but if a quick bite to eat is what you're looking for, look further. Luckily we gave ourselves well over 2 hours before the show to eat and we needed every minute of it. The service, while nice and accommodating were slow as snails.
