I believe there was one MAYBe two waiters serving the entire spot. Thank God our waiter had a helper or we would of missed our show. The food while large portioned was just alright. I tried the Guy's Chinese salad. It was pretty good. For close to $15.00 for a salad, it should be, right? We had wanted coffee and dessert but we spent the whole two hours waiting for our meal. They do get a full star for serving Coke products and I can say they do have free refills but good luck getting a server to refill it. With so many other options in the area, I'm bummed we wasted an SF visit here. There's one next to my work and it's a lot better. Besides, no one even sang no opera.
author: Jen O.

description: I came here with a group of coworkers around lunch time, was pretty surprised of the location that is was not busy. I ordered the chicken melt w/salad and pink lemonade. When the food came it was alot so I had leftovers and I must say the sandwich was very good, the service however was blah. I would go back to experience more food items and hopefully next time the service will be better.
author: Alyce S.

description:
An empty restaurant, staff who are too busy talking with each other to help customers, and a manager who won't take his face out of the computer screen to look around the restaurant.  Add to that the lack of the ability to cook a cheeseburger medium rare.  After two fail attempts to do so, I left.
The place has great desserts but otherwise is an overpriced joke.
author: James D.

description:
I can't tell you how many times I've eaten at Max's -- I've been to at least 5 different Max's over the years, but mostly I've dined at the Opera Plaza location.  I've always had great food and great service.  However, about 6 months ago, we received really bad service at Opera Plaza, sowe stopped going... Today, due to the proximity of the symphony, we came in again and had the most outrageously bad service ever.  Sat down at noon, waiter came 10 minutes later -- drinks were delivered another 10 minutes later.  When the food finally arrived about 30 minutes after we were seated, it was wrong.  Waiter didn't even apologize -- and then he never stopped by our table again until we tracked him down for the bill.

I will still go to Max's -- just not this location.  Something is SERIOUSLY wrong with the way this location operates.  I miss the days when the servers were friendly, the service prompt and the orders were correct.  Thankfully, the last time I was at the Stanford location and the San Ramon location, everything was fine.  I think the fat lady is singing at the Opera Plaza location...
author: G M.

description: Best chocolate cake in San Francisco...Try to sit in Mariam's section, she's wonderful!
author: T W.

description:
This is an upfront and honest kind of place.  The food is great, portions are hearty, and you'll probably want to come back another time when you have room for dessert.
The bathroom situation is a bit of a nightmare; not nearly enough stalls for the size of restaurant, but otherwise the service is excellent and the dining area is welcoming.  It's very nicely decorated at the holidays if you are looking for somewhere festive.  Well located for AMC Van Ness.
author: Rebecca N.

description: I'm a matzah ball soup snob. This is the best ever. Period. Get it and don't look back!
author: SFfamily S.

description:
Hey, Mr. Max, what's up with all the mirrored walls in this place.  I mean, I can be as vain as the next person, but there's only so much of myself, I can look at.

Also, while you're at it, Mr. Max, maybe you should train your servers not to have a horrified look of disgust on their face when asked by a patron if a particular item on the menu is good or not.  The server tried to cover it up by saying, "Oh, no, no, it's good, it's really good, I DO like it!"  I mean, I may be a little slow, but I'm not that slow.  It probably would have helped also if the server could have looked me in the eye, at any point, during the time he was providing service to our table.  

If the food made up for the lack in service, I would have given a higher rating, but unfortunately, my food was also not up to par.  I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich, which comes with sweet potato fries and coleslaw.  The meat and BBQ sauce was bland, and the roll didn't really stand up to the sauce, which made the sandwich bread basically turn mushy.  The best part of my meal was the sweet potato fries and even they were just average, really.  They weren't as crunchy or as flavorful as I'd prefer.

Also, at the end of our meal, we were overcharged for one of the items because they had not corrected the price on the lunch menu and charged us the price from their dinner menu instead.  If the person who was overcharged wasn't such a penny pinching, Groupon deal using, tightwad, none of the rest of us would have caught that error. The server apologized and corrected the error, but seemed a little irked by the complaint in general.  

With so many other restaurant options in the area, I don't think I'll be coming around to Max's again, anytime soon.
author: Danielle O.

description: My childhood=) My parents used to take us to this one after we would see the Nutcracker Ballet next door and to the Max's that used to be in Union Square ALL THE TIME!!!! I'm so sad that one is closed. We've never really had a bad time here, food is always really great. Sometimes they can be pretty busy and it takes a little while to get in or get your food, but I don't remember it ever being horrible. I think the last time I went here was 2 years ago? Miss it a lot, wish it was closer! Their desserts btw are to die for!
author: Julia R.

description: Went here after the opera one night. The éclairs are to die for. It comes both chocolate and custard filled. Just YUMMY!!!
author: Joe S.

description:
The menu states "this is a bad place for a diet"! To be accurate, it's just a bad place! Period.  Been dining here for nearly 20 years. This place went downhill FAST!
Overpriced and steep decline in the quality of the food! The waitstaff confirmed our suspicions the establishment was under new (e.g. poor) management. This place is doomed to fail, just as our meal was an epic failure . Two of three meat dishes in our order were incorrect~ over cooked and cold. Both dishes were sent back to the kitchen. Total time wasted here: 1.5 hours  for two burgers and a brisket. This place will be outta business in 10 minutes. The ice water was perfect. If you'd like to waste money on a most unsatisfactory meal at a three ring circus, then go to Max's. Otherwise, AVOID.
author: Baby J.

description: This is for the mature crowd, no rowdies.  Surrounding City Hall, federal workers, go there with a group.  Their waitstaff might need more professionalism & appearance; their food is a lot to down.  Always good to know you get a lot.  Anything there to order is good.  No rowdies because it's a working crowd from nearby.  Good to know your boss is at the table.
author: BanBan B.

description:
Being that my parents have been eating their Niagra Falls cake since I was in the womb, I have a soft spot for Max's.  I think its a totally fun experience and while the food is maybe not the most amazing I've ever had, it's fine enough to precede a night at the theater.

Not sure I can name favorites, but last time I had:
Caesar Salad
Max 'n' Cheese
Niagra Falls Cake

And I'd happily eat any of it again!
author: Karin M.

description: The best thing about Max's is their happy hour, location and NY style cheese cake. The second is there is a pianist at nighttime who takes requests and who will appreciate your generous gratuitiy. Sometimes the servers sing. The food and service are mediocre at best. How this place can screw up breakfast and brunch is always a mystery. Our French Toast was wet soggy bread sprinkled with cinnamon and powdered sugar and the OJ had pits and it was impossible to get cream for our coffee! Thirty bucks later we decided never again to attempt breakfast there..., but, cocktails and desert or bar food is def the way to go here. Oh, you can now pre-order and pick up food to go through 24houreats, still, there are far better choices out there, unless you have a hankering for a Dr. Brown's Celray Tonic or black and white cookie..
author: Lou S.

description:
I ordered a chicken breast sandwich on sourdough, with a side order of potato salad, to go.  Woman taking order was surly, and seemed bothered that I asked for a sandwich, or something.  

While waiting, I noticed that the sign said sandwiches come with a soda or bottle of water.  She hands me my (packaged up) sandwich.  I ask, "Do I get a drink with that?"  She says yes, and asks me what I want. If I had not asked for it, I apparently would not have gotten it. 

I get back to my office, open the sandwich and find a chicken breast on a whole wheat roll with french fries.  Oops.  So I call, explain that I don't have time to walk back there now, and ask what they can do about this.  Answer: "Next time we will give you the side that you want."  What?  Really?

And the chicken breast was dry and tough, the tomato was not ripe, and I did not have any ketchup for the fries.

Based on this experience, two stars is probably overly generous, but I have had decent (if overpriced) food here before, so I will give them a break and not give them one star.
author: Peter A.

description: Huge portions and great service are the stars at this Van Ness St. Location.  You won't be disappointed with any of the dishes.  My favorite is the Pastrami on rye which hits the spot.  Soups are also delightful and great on a cold SF foggy night.  Great place to grab a meal before you see the Opera or Symphony.
author: Robert L.

description:
My family and I had the WORST experience here yesterday. It was an exceptionally hot day in SF (78 degrees) and we asked our waiter to see if they can turn the air on as it was extremely uncomfortable. He said they have no Ac. I find that hard to believe that a long standing restaurant in a top tourist city would not have Ac. But when it came time to take our order, he did not write any of the 5 entrees down and almost all of them had exceptions. And we kept suggesting that he should write it down. Of course 2 of the orders were wrong and he accused my husband of lying about his order. We then asked to speak with the manager and in front of the manager he again accused my husband of lying. What happened to the customer is always right?
 The two meals he brought that were incorrect were inedible. And we were only comped for one. Therefore, no tip. My husband and I are well travelled and also eat out a lot. The number of times I have returned food is less than a handful. I cannot remember a time that I have asked to speak with a manager.  I guess it's true that only dissatisfied customers write bad reviews. Never ever go here!  No wonder so many of their restaurants have closed.
author: Ilene Z.

description:
Max's was our go-to place. They have something for everyone. Used to love their extended menu, but ever since they cut it down most of our favorites are gone. They serve big portions, quality is a notch above diners. I agree that the patrons are mostly elderly. 

Loved:
-Reuben sandwich (cornbeef is the best I've had when fresh)
-Vegetable sandwich
-Stuffed mushrooms
-Cookies
-Piano nights

Not so much:
-Limited menu
-Some of the side dishes are uncovered as you walk to the hostess stand
author: Sarah H.

description:
Max karma.

Ordered: Half portion of their "famous" French toast.

Received: Full portion of their "famous" French toast.

Kitchen mistake. Server and I agreed the unexpected extra should be left for someone in need. Done: http://www.replate.org

As for the half I did eat it was good but not great. Far from famous. In a blind test with something from the frozen section of the grocer not sure I could have told the difference.

Third star for the reasonable price ($6) and friendly staff. No one earns bonus stars for karma. It's just the right thing to do.
author: Jason B.

description: My wife and I have been coming from out of town for years. Yesterday we took my wife's family to eat, 12 of us. They had the table ready and were patient while all the family arrived. The service was a bit poor, especially for a $43 tip. The sandwiches were wonderful as were the crab cakes and desserts. The fish and chips were terrible.
author: Parker E.

description:
They have cut back on their food portions and servings of coleslaw.
Breakfast is reasonable, though.
author: Diana R.

description:
I have eaten here several times over the past five years, mainly before attending events at the San Francisco Opera House.  After my experience last night I've had enough of this place.

The food is decent but nothing memorable.  I accept this, however,  as Max's mainly is a deli that serves dinner.  If one wants a better culinary experience there are plenty of good restaurants in the area.

My big issue is the service.  For example, last night we arrived at 6:00 and were seated about five minutes later.  We did not see our waiter until about 6:25.  We told him that we had 7:30 opera tickets, to which he replied "I can't guarantee anything" regarding when we would get our food.  We ordered our drinks and food at the same time.  Fifteen minutes later our food came out, but our drinks were nowhere to be seen.  After prompting the bus person to find our waiter, he delivered our drinks a few minutes later.  Our waiter didn't display any sign of urgency despite the busy night.  It appeared that he just didn't care.

My one star for Max's is not for our single experience last night.  Max's has earned this star based upon poor and indifferent service on most of my visits.

I'd rather eat at the McDonald's across the street than return to Max's.   I'll at least be treated better by the kids behind the counter.
author: David W.

description: I have been eating here for 20 years, and continue to be delighted with the tastiness and consistency. The corned beef, or pastrami Reuben sandwich is my favorite, and compares favorably with the best in New York. Hard to believe? Try it yourself. It is a great combination of rye bread, cheese, sauerkraut, and perfect meat. They will also do a mixed combo, mixing the pastrami and corned beef. Other favorite dishes include the Tuna Melt, and the crab cakes. For dessert, I like the plain cheese cake, which is one of the best anywhere in the US. This deli is a rare find... enjoy!
author: Richard T.

description:
In search of comfort food - that was my goal.  After an afternoon of walking throughout Union Square then walking up into the Tenderloin I made a turn onto Van Ness and ended up at Opera Plaza.  I needed refreshment and I needed nourishment so I decided to step into Max's Opera Cafe.  The only other Max's I've ever eaten in was the one that use to be on Third near the Moscone Center.  I remember I ate there often because their food was always good and "homey".

Max's Opera Cafe was a bit of a disappointment though.  When only the service highlights the visit that's not a very good sign.  I received outstanding service.  I was seated promptly and the waiter/server was polite and courteous throughout the afternoon bringing my beverage to me quickly, bringing my food to me quickly, checking up on me twice and just being a very good waiter.

I ordered the table brewed peach ice tea which I thought was kind of cool and unique.  The waiter brought a tall glass filled to the very top with ice cubes.  He explained to me that the syrupy concoction in the base of my glass was the peach-flavored syrup.  In a small metal pot was a tea bag submerged in hot water.  The waiter suggested that I could mix the tea into the glass whenever I felt like depending on how strong I wanted the tea to be.  I like my tea super strong and the mixed-in ice tea was exactly the refreshment I needed.

I decided against ordering a burger and ended up choosing Max's Famous Meatloaf served with mashed potatoes and a vegetable.  The food arrived in less than five minutes along with a metal basket containing a couple of hot rolls and several cubes of butter.  There was a plain white dinner roll, and a darker roll which had a pleasant cinnamon scent to it.  I cracked open the darker roll to find that it was indeed a raisin roll filled with dark and golden raisins.  The roll had a thin, chewy crust and soft, chewy bread.  It was excellent.

I wish I could have said the same of the main entree.  I'm not sure why the meatloaf is "famous" because it certainly was not for the taste which was pretty generic.  The thick slice of meat patty had good firmness and nice texture, but I was not satisfied with its taste at all.  It was completely covered in a dark brown mushroom sauce which simply tasted sodium heavy.  The potatoes were lukewarm kept on the warm side only because a thick, gooey light brown gravy was piping hot.  The carrots were quite obviously reheated since they had now reached a level of extreme rubberness.  Had there not been diners seated around me I might have certainly tossed a piece of carrot off the table top just to see how high it would bounce.

The desserts looked decadent, but I passed on them.  If there is a next time here I'll consider a burger.  Three stars but just barely.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: The food here is super good.but the staff is really rude (except our waiter who was nice and helpful). We came in for dinner last night and I asked the hostess twice when we could be seated as the place was empty (long curly hair).  She just stared at me and refused to answer,  as did who I assume was a chef (blue coat). He was yelling at someone on the phone.  I've been a server for years so have a point of reference. This place is pretty expensive and need nicer staff. Unfortunately it is some of the best food around so I just try to ignore their attitudes.
author: Michelle S.

description:
I remember a few years ago, someone told me Max's is a "nice" restaurant. First of all, it is a chain restaurant and it is nothing more than a glorified Marie Calendars. I'm so disappointed that we didn't eat somewhere better considering the amount of money we all spent for terrible Dennys quality food. The only reason we came in was because everything else was ridiculously packed after the Giants parade. It was either Jack in the Box or Max's. I really regret not settling for JitB; at least I would have known what I was ordering was going to be somewhat yummy. 

I excitedly ordered a Caribbean BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich thinking I was going to bite into juicy deliciousness, but I ended up only eating the fries. They basically chopped up super dried, overcooked pork chops into big chunks and put it on a roll with some BBQ sauce on the side. How dare they call this a pulled pork sandwich!!! 

I'll never go to Max's again and will do everyone a favor and advise them not to either.
author: Kristy H.

description: I only have one thing to say about this place, skip dinner and go for the dessert and music. The service was terrible and it wasn't even busy. Ok that's two things. Enough said.
author: John A.

description: Love their veggie-stuffed baked potato with side caesar for lunch!
author: M M.

description:
Very Disappointing !  The beef in my "Philly Cheesesteak" sandwich seemed to be  pot roast, not steak.  Small sandwich without much in it and on a cheap roll.  I could have done better at Subway.  The potato salad with fresh red potatoes was tasty, though.  My tab for this was $21.   

A couple sitting next to me told the manager that they weren't eating or paying for their dinners because the steaks were so fatty.  Then they walked out.  Apparently Maxs has some serious issues with meat quality.
author: Ed P.

description: Great classic restaurant. Expensive but not deserving of the bad reviews. Been coming here for years. To the management, please work on your service speed. It was hard tracking down a server when we were in on New Years eve.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Good food. Good prices. Friendly service. The rueben is really big and delicious. I miss the 3rd and Folsom location.
author: Andrew K.

description: Ordered the roast beef special for $29 it was delivered cold really not even warm, baked potato undercooked. Roast beef was decent enough but Stone cold sent back we should've sent back my dinner mates but we didn't they bring it back  20 min. later and it looks like  microwaved.  On Friday evening at 7:30 the place was half-empty no wonder really really Poor poor Service and food Will never go back.
author: Frank M.

description:
Parking sucks around here, the meters eat up your coins like crazy!

Service here was nice, the menu was cool they have a list of rules that the employees are supposed to follow and if they break any of the rules you get certain free things like cake. Too bad our server didn't break any of the rules though haha.

The food was good. My sister LOVED her corn beef sandwich. My tuna melt was good, too. The bread was "cooked" just the way i LOVE it.. buttery and crispy =D yum! We ordered a sundae for dessert which was yummy as well. 

I'd like to come back to try the half off mimosa's on the weekend brunch and would also like to come back to see the servers who supposedly sing? That'd be interesting!
author: Andrea M.

description: Good happy hour drinks, good sandwiches, nice piano player.
author: April M.

description: They keep going down hill.  Service tonight was pitiful.  Little latin guy does not understand what it means to make a "sparkling" lemonade, forgot to bring out bread, did not offer dessert before putting the check down...Food was good.  Service....meh.
author: Eli B.

description:
I can honestly say that I've been coming here since I was in grade school. It became one of the many places we would frequently visit as a treat everytime we were in the city, especially after watching a show.

Anyway, the food is not 5-star classy but I must say that I have never had a meal that I didn't like. I've tried their salmon, the Philly cheesesteak sandwich, burgers/sliders, crab cakes, caesar salad, Reuben sandwiches, steaks, and many of their pastas as well. To this day, my favorite is the skirt steak MEDIUM and shrimp scampi. Desserts here are delicious! I ALWAYS get the sundae with multiple scoops of vanilla ice cream with bittersweet hotfudge, marshmallow cream, and candied peanuts.. generous enough to share between 4 people and still feel satisfied! NOMNOM 

The portions here are HUGE! Plus they give you fresh and warm bread rolls (sourdough and this dark sweet cinnamony kind too). 

The atmosphere is pretty chill. It's kind of like a high-end diner? But not high end like a No-Jeans as T-shirt policy. It's a casual environment and you can see people of all kinds and ages dressed down and up. They have a full- service bar (hard liquor, wine, beer) and a piano/piano-man that plays music to which most of the waiters/waitresses will sing with to entertain you. 

Bathrooms are pretty clean which is a major plus as well!

Lastly, this place has a bunch of rules that the restaraunt/waiters/waitresses have to follow. You can find them printed on the napkins and in the menu. They're pretty funny and I'm always hoping they break one so I can get a free drink or free whole cake or something!! ---but nope nothing yet and I've been coming here since I was 6!! YAY FOR MAX's!!
author: KimberLy M.

description:
Food 5 stars, service 1 star, 3 stars is generous

We came here for a late lunch and it was very crowded. While waiting at the hostess stand we were salivating over the food that was put up....looked yummy! We had been moving all day and were very hungry. We thought PERFECT PLACE! 

We got seated and ordered. Our food was really really good, although 2 of the 3 orders were not correct. Our waiter never asked us if we wanted drinks. If he had, then he would have realized...because we would have told him, that we are all water drinkers...no one ever came back to fill our water. 

One person ordered a burger with cheese, avocado, and bacon (like I said, we were moving all day and hungry). No bacon.  I ordered a salmon salad that comes with red onions. I asked for the red onions grilled. Again, the waiter looked like I was imposing. I said, "this salad comes with red ions, I would like to know if I can get them grilled?" He wrote something down, did not answer, and scurried away. Oh, and I asked for dressing on the side. When I got my salad, it had no dressing on the side...and white onions grilled...with some onion skin in there. Ever try to eat grilled onion skin? 

When we told the waiter about the bacon, he seemed very bothered by this...as if it were somehow our fault, or worse yet, that we should just accept it. The only thing they could do was charge him for a regular burger. This is a critical piece of information in this review.

When we got out bill, I was charged $2 for those onions. The waiter never said that it'll be $2 for the onions...and they were the WRONG onions....REALLY??? I did not say anything because of the burger price, but this is wrong.

Would I go back? Yep. If only to see if our experience was a Max's rule or an exception. i hope the latter, but based on the reviews, I am not hopeful.

I hope that Max's management reads this and all of the other reviews and takes note.
author: Sue F.

description: Had the best Rueben on rye! Hubby enjoyed the managers Prime Rib Special! Great piano music and Chef serenade! Waiter, Mike was fantastic! We will be back to have another awesome evening and delicious food!
author: Cheri F.

description: Huge portion, below average taste. I had the lamb burger. The bread came out cold and old. I asked for medium rare while it was actually medium well. The only reason I keep going there is because it is a nice spot for dinner before the shows.
author: Siruo Z.

description: I recently went to the opera house cafe and was very disappointed .The restaurant is set up so when you walk in through the front door, you're walking along side the food that has just been cooked. The kitchen is exposed and the chef is placing orders that are done right there on a counter where tons of people are walking in to get a table. The salad dressings are in open containers at waist length as well amongst other food in the "please wait to be seated" line. It's very unsanitary. Once the hostess has your information, whole you're waiting for an available table; the only place to stand is the "waiting area" which is directly in the center of the restaurant and in the middle of server traffic. Which is awkward along with annoying. When I finally got a table, my husband and I ordered a salad to split. Unfortunately the menu didn't look appetizing, so we chose a safe dish. We ordered the chicken Cesar salad and told the waitress we would like to split the dish. She brings out the salad on one plate with no chicken. We asked for another plate since we would be splitting the dish, I assumed she was going to bring one when she served the salad but no. We never received another dish, or water refills. Come to find out, our waitress was too busy singing in the front of the restaurant. We had to hunt down someone to pay the bill and we left. Long story short, poor service, unsanitary conditions, and a minimal menu.
author: Holly H.

description: They don't even deserve one star.  The food is not good.  The bread was hard and dry.  My friend had chicken that was very dry.   They messed up our order too.  It is crazy over priced too.  If you're hungry and this is the last option, it's better to skip the meal.  I don't know how this place stays in business in San Francisco.
author: Mike L.

description: Max's Opera Plaza always rocks!!!  One of the best corned beef/pastrami sandwiches in town.  The wait staff is always attentive and genuinely friendly.  The airy and bright space is fantastic for enjoying a beautiful day in the Van Ness corridor, or just people watch.
author: Chuck A.

description:
Overpriced. I've also eaten sandwiches at subway better than this place. 
They also tried to charge me more for my Pastrami Reuben  by making it a Pastrami 'Sandwich' on the bill,  which costs more. 
Never again...
author: Phil W.

description:
This is seriously below average food at above average prices.  It is a touristy kitschy
conveniently located place they get away with serving artless food to people who may not care about good food.  I had breakfast there this week because a friend was eating there and I was hungry.  So against my better judgement I ordered something and threw caution to the wind.  I ordered the French toast and it was like a diner in the suburbs of ...nowhere.  white bread slice french toast and without thinking... my bad..... I used the "maple syrup"  Of course this was not real maple syrup and I was not thinking because I don;t usually eat a place that would serve a human being fake crap like that.  But,  as I said, I was super hungry and it just happened.   By the evening, I had a bad migraine headache, which I never get.   And I realized it was from the high fructose corn syrup that I had been served to me at Max's.  The next day I got a rash that lasted for 2 more days.  This kind of  corn syrup served as Maple syrup , you don't usually find in San Francisco where people are foodies and also care about what they put in their bodies.  I DO NOT recommend this restaurant. everything is below average. I have been trapped into eating there before and it is all barely edible.
author: Marc D.

description: It was our family tradition to go to Max's every year before seeing a show. Last night, however, we were held in limbo standing in a doorway waiting for almost 45 minutes (they had said 20 mins. when we came in). We waited so long there was no time to make another plan for dinner before our show. Not only that, but one customer (who had come in after us) complained to the manager and got seated ahead of us. So not only did they 1. misstate the wait time, 2. not communicate with us regarding their mistake, and 3. leave us with no options, they 4. did not stick to the order in which people arrived and rewarded the angriest customers instead. Bad, bad, bad, bad. We're never going to do that again.
author: Anna F.

description: The food at May's has really gone down hill. I routinely had lunches here . Rubens were great. Brisket was good and desserts indulgent  Recently the food is inconsistent. The servers seem bored.  Sometimes you get pickles and sometimes not.  The desserts cabinet is almost empty with few choices. This looks like a place on its way out
author: Lambchop B.

description: Always tasty and large portions. Great piano and singing too!
author: Joan G.

description:
This place has musicians playing almost all the time!! It's so beautiful!! Who wouldn't enjoy a meal while listening to peaceful opera or piano music!!!

I had gotten the matzo ball soup! It doesn't look like much, but the taste of it is something else!! Its a must try! I wish I had a chance to get dessert, but maybe ill get it next time!

I heard that you can get a good deal if you purchase gift cards from cosco ahead of time! Its a shame i didnt!! But the food was still worth every penny!
author: Pao W.

description:
I gave this a thought for a month, and after seeing some negative reviews, I decided to justify myself for this review.

As an entire restaurant, it's 3 stars because I like the way it's set up.  It's gotta a style.  Max's to me is one of the restaurants that represent America.  

I don't want to remember this bitter dining experience, so I'm just listing up the lessons I learned from it.

1. Don't push yourself to eat at a restaurant near closing time.  Your waitress wants to go home & so do kitchen people (see the photos).  The bathroom could be nasty.

2. Don't eat at a restaurant when the manager or owner isn't present.  It's just my guess, but things could have been better with him.

3. Don't take out desserts; they might be spoiled, and you get VERY disappointed on the way back home in your car.  I was so upset that made me speechless the entire trip (which my hubby might have appreciated, which I won't know).

4. Following #3, if you ever take out desserts, don't get your expectation too high; always be prepared the unexpected & the worst.

To conclude, it might have been mere bad timing.  Max's could be a REALLY nice restaurant, and I REALLY regret to say this, but I'm resting Max's for good in my book.
author: Terri M.

description: I will never eat at Max's again.   40% of the food in California ends up food waste, and Max's prides itself on their large portions.   They used to have 2 sizes of salalds, but they eliminated the small size.   No one can possiblby eat the large size.    When will they develop a conscience?
author: Sandi M.

description:
We had lunch on Sunday. The table was ready for us immediately. The service was friendly and quick but not intrusive.
The mimosa for half price was very good.
The beet salad was fresh and tasty. It was big enough for two.
The coconut crumble dessert was also enough for two. The macaroon was a refreshing change.
The restaurant was just like I remember it from years ago. I was surprised at the negative reviews on this site. I wondered if we were in the same place!
author: janis s.

description: It's in a weird location! I've would've never found it if I didn't walk around the area! The food is quite good & cheap! Good place to have some alone time!
author: Anthony S.

description: First time dining here as it was a recommendation from a local. Service was hospitable and courteous. Food was flavorful. Portions are very large though. I had the Vegetable wrap and had to ask for the other half to boxed. The Arugula Salad was very good too! I'll be back!
author: Khola J.

description: I understand that there is new management. The menu is now very slim with few options. The prices are no longer competitive. The waiter was friendly, but not efficient. I am sorry to give up on Max's. It is no longer recommended.
author: Lawrence L.

description:
We have a yearly tradition of taking our kids to Max's prior to the Nutcracker ballet. It is something we look forward to, as I am sure the restaurant is well aware of the Nutcracker customers that follow this same tradition.

We recently dined at Max's on 12/14/11. We arrived at 5:00p, and were the first table in an empty section. While waiting for over 20 minutes for a server to take a drink order, we noticed the section getting fuller and fuller. When our server, Blanca, finally decided to come to our table, we could tell that she was in a foul mood. 

We finally got served our dinner after a full hour of waiting. The restaurant was in full swing by then with a line forming on the waiting list. One would think, if you are the manager of a restaurant with guaranteed customers going to the Nutcracker, that you would schedule your best and most efficient servers to make the most money, right?

Blanca forgot most of our order. She left ALL of the dirty plates and cups on the table for the ENTIRE meal. I had to hunt her down to order a glass of wine with my dinner, and again to order dessert for my kids. Whenever you tried to get her attention, she blatantly ignored us - as well as most of the table in her section.

While I usually am not one to post comments on Yelp, this disaster of a dining experience was just too much to ignore. The final straw was when she gave us our bill with a built in 18% gratuity. Seriously? So you flat out ignore your customers, forget most of their order, never clear the table or ask if we need anything, and then slap our faces with 18% for doing NOTHING? A complete insult in my opinion!

Sadly, I think our dining tradition prior to attending the ballet will be finding a new location. It's too bad that the management has become so uninterested in customer experience. In these tough economic times, customer service is EVERYTHING and should NEVER be taken for granted.
author: Laura B.

description:
I've been coming to the Max's in the opera plaza location since I was a little girl, and I'm a huge fan. My favorite thing to order is a cup of the chicken matzo ball soup and a caesar salad. I love their iced tea as well - they bring it to you as hot tea in an individual tea pot and then you pour it over ice. 

The wait staff is always super friendly and helpful - I don't think I've ever had my order messed up, and they notice right away if your drink needs refilling.

Their dessert menu is also fantastic. I looove their strawberry shortcake and their Niagara Falls cake. I also like how you can order these in half slices too - their full slices are incredibly generous and I usually can't finish them! When I come here with my family, we'll typically order a full slice of cake to share and then enjoy it over coffee (did I mention their coffee is also great here?)

Pros: 
-Great food at reasonable prices
-Amazing desserts
-Friendly and attentive wait staff

Cons: 
-Can get busy, especially when a show has just let out. If you go during one of these times, it might be a little loud and you might have to wait for a table - but it's worth it!
author: Renee N.

description: Food is the focus and it is always very good.  Have been an enthusiastic customer for many years and my only disappointment as been an occasional lapse in good service, generally when they are slammed busy.
author: Joseph M.

description:
Absolutely love this place. We had our boss retirement's party there. The party was a huge success. Every guest was pleased with food and service. I give this place 5 stars because of its fast and friendly service, reasonable price, great hospitality and delicious food. 

The crab cake, grilled shrimps and beef kabob were dangerously awesome!  We will definitely go back.
author: Mojgan Y.

description:
Max's is one of those places that for some reason it never occurs to me to visit.   But the last time I visited, I had such a great experience.  It was a rainy, cold Sunday night.  And it was the birthday of a loved one who has since passed away, so we were all feeling a bit melancholic.  And nostalgic.  And hungry.  And driving down Gough.  When someone suggested Max's.  

So glad we went -- we were greeted warmly, and seated at a table near the grand piano.  The pianist was playing a wonderful medley of Broadway show tunes -- coincidentally some of our departed loved one's favorites.  Then, one of the waiters stood at the mic and sang.  It was so beautiful.  At a nearby table, a birthday was being celebrated, and a trio of waiters sang "Happy Birthday" in perfect harmony. Such synchronicity is a joy. 

The bread was great, a nice selection of sourdough rolls, walnut-cranberry rolls and whole wheat slices.  And our waiter very graciously kept refilling the basket.  Entrees were fine -- but what was really memorable were the desserts -- so yummy, and such giant portions -- we ordered the Opera Cake, the hot fudge sundae, and the apple crisp.  Wow!  So fabulous!  We ended up taking half of every portion home!   

Parking in this area can be a real pain in the ass, but there is a garage underneath if you can't find street parking.
author: Bevy M.

description:
HOW CAN A PLACE THAT SERVES HUNDRED'S OF SANDWICHES DAILY HAVE STALE BREAD?

Wow... this place was packed on a Thursday afternoon at 2pm.  Between the tourists visiting City Hall and patrons of the Opera and Symphony, they must serve hundred's of sandwiches a day, no?

So why in the world was our turkey sandwich served on crumbly stale bread?  And to add insult to injury, the turkey was chalky dry and undersalted and the bacon was brittle and hard.  They heap on this dreadful turkey as if quantity will make up for quality.  

Service is apathetic.  I asked for napkins and the gal threw a huge plastic wrapped bundle on the counter.  Then when we got to our destination to eat our lunch, we found that she didn't bother to include a fork in our bag, so we had no way to eat the potato salad.  Maybe she did us a favor if the turkey sandwich was any indication.

Such a shame.  Max's used to be such a fantastic chain under the original management. Max's is NOT a good place to eat.
author: Rita S.

description: I loved this place.  I came here with my good friend, Linda the Great.  How great is she?  She's so great, she makes Alexander the Great, look like Alexander the Wuss!  We have lunch once a month, and her Greatness picked the restaurant.  I had the half sandwich and cup of soup, tomato basil with cheese tortellini soup and the chopped chicken liver sandwich.  OMG!  I felt like I was in a Jewish deli in LA!  The chopped liver was delicious!  Her Greatness had the Turkey and Swiss on rye, with a chopped salad.  The sandwich was so big, her Greatness had to take half home!  I had a dirty vodka martini(superb) and her Greatness had iced tea.  Our server was ebullient Lizzie.  It was a beautiful day and we enjoyed the view through the huge glass windows.  Life is good!
author: Blondie R.

description: worst place ever!!! My family of 12 people had Mother's Day reservations and they emailed my mom at 10pm the night before saying our reservations were cancelled. We had people coming from outside the Bay Area and they didn't offer us anything to compensate for their unprofessionalism, terrible management and customer service. my mind is blown they won't take responsibility for leaving us with no place to go on mothers day morning. Don't EVER come here.
author: C M.

description:
My wife and I occasionally dine at Max's because it's very convenient to Symphony Hall. Previous visits have been pretty good, but last night was a strikeout.

After a 30-minute wait (they said it would be 20-30), we were seated. Water and bread came out within a few minutes. So far, so good. That would be the last time we would be offered either.

After 45 minutes, our sirloins arrived. We both had ordered medium rare; both were well done. We called over our super busy waitress and she took them back to the kitchen. About 30 minutes later, they came back out. Mine was medium rare; my wife's was mooing it was so bloody.

If you can't get a medium rare steak from a restaurant after two tries, it fails in my book. My wife ate a few bites, but we had to get to the symphony so didn't send it back a second time. She took a doggy bag and we fed it to our dog when we got home.

The accompaniments were just OK...creamed spinach and a baked potato. Again, a hard dinner to screw up, but that they did.

Not sure if we'll be back. Will probably look for a new option near the symphony.
author: Calif C.

description:
Seriously awful food. In a foodie town you can do better.

Max's is a chain restaurant that serves fatty, expensive appetizers, and bland deli food in glutton-sized portions. The salads could use more greens, especially for the price.

The brisket melt sandwich was terribly soggy and drippy, and fell apart immediately. The beef was mushy and lacked flavor. The bread was barely grilled. The Ceaser side salad was miniscule and had far too much dressing.

The chicken Cobb salad had decently fresh ingredients (the tomatoes were very flavorful), but needed more greens.

The 'fresh crusty bread' was previously-frozen oven warmed rolls that were chewy and overly sweet.

The prices are not cheap, even by San Francisco standards: Appetizers run $9-$14, sandwiches are $13-20 ($13 for a grilled cheese!) salads run $13-$18, and you'll pay $17 for a chicken pot pie.

One bright spot: The service was pleasant and low key.

You can find better deli for less money, or if you want to spend $50 for lunch there are SO many places you can dine - not just eat.
author: Monarch B.

description: This used to be such a destination place. The menu was a book...like at the Cheesecake Factory. Now, its a sheet. So many of their standard items are gone: the not so mini reuben, the barbque appetizer plate. I had the red cabbage soup today which is delicious but the portions are miniscule. they used to have cups and bowls. Now its something inbetween and tiny. MAX's used to be so fun to go to. Now...nothing. Save your money and go to cheesecake Factory for that wow factor. Unfortunately, MAX is the only real restaurant near the Opera House unless you go to Hayes Street.
author: George K.

description: Jewish fusion, upscale diner with all the right selections. If you're looking for New York-esque authenticity, you won't quite find it here but the food never disappoints. Large portions and a casual environment make this a great stop if you've got a big appetite and need a Rueben in a pinch.
author: Hunter S.

description: Stopped in to have a snack at the bar. I ordered a lemon drop. I've had better. I've had worse. At APPLEBEE's. No, wait a sec, the one at APPLEBEE"S was better! I have had more professional, friendlier bartenders. Almost ANYWHERE (including Applebee's).PS Not wanting to dis Applebee's here...
author: Leslie C.

description: Came in for lunch and ordered the Barbeque Pork Sliders.  It came out well presented with sauce on the side but at first bite I was unimpressed.  The pork was not juicy and tender as I had expected, but was rather dry and rough.  No sign of the pickled onions either.  No amount of sauce could save it, not that the sauce was spectacular either...tasted like it came from a bottle. The bottom buns also got soggy by the time I finished one slider. Thoroughly unimpressed.  At least my pear cider (from a bottle) was decent.
author: Renee L.

description:
Their pastrami sandwiches are as good as they come -- comparable to the best of New York. Lots of mustard options, too -- several available at the table. 

And add to that the excellent singing and piano playing -- a perfect prelude or denouement to an evening at the symphony, opera, ballet, or Music Conservatory performance.
author: Arthur C.

description: This has been the 5th time I have been to Max's. I came at noon expecting it to be busy.  It wasn't.  The food was hot. The service was quick and cheery.  Overall it was an okay lunch.  I had the hamburger.  Too much bread.  Could have a smaller bun,  the fries were hot, steak fries.  With tax and San Francisco, you will pay $12.50 for just a burger and fries. McDonalds is across the street, it is much better than McDonalds.  For a quick, hot meal, it is a good place to go.
author: Mark S.

description: I used to love Max's, but my reuben tonight was sad, as was my friends. They used to get it so right, but these were greasy, skimpy, and lacked the freshness I expect from a deli. Fries and pickle rocked, service was great, but I came for the reuben.
author: andrew f.

description: I hosted a farewell cocktail party for my boss here and the space was perfect for the crowd (100ish people). The staff/management where all great and very attentive and accommodating. The food (finger noshes) were all very good and they provided more than enough. For the price, it was a steal! I highly recommend Max's for group get togethers and will definitely go back for lunch or dinner.
author: korey m.

description:
Well, an update on my last review. I ate there recently, and noted that the place is still in dire need of a refurbishing. The decor was in awful taste when it was new many years ago, and time hasn't helped matters. It would be a simple matter to roll a coat of paint on some of the worst offenses, and replace the carpeting. It's now just a matter of absentee ownership, and sloppy business practices.
The food is awful, and to my shock I saw a fat little mouse frolicking along the baseboard, presumably looking for crumbs. The manager commented that they're around no matter what, and hiring an exterminator doesn't help much.
Too bad, because expensive high-rises will be going up on the length of this section of Van Ness. This could be a great local pub (like Perry's) with a little paint, a new chef, a new property management company, and a bucket and mop. The location could also benefit from expanding into a sidewalk cafe on warm evenings. 
There are a lot of local attractions on the premises such as an art movie house and bookstore. However, this restaurant is now just an annoyance not a destination.
author: angela gilbert w.

description: My girlfriend and I came here for dinner. First off the service is awful, we've gotten some glares. I had a chopped steak, the steak was bland and the gravy over made it have a texture of baby food plus a heap of lettuce that was a little past its prime. My girlfriend's burger was pretty good except the meat it was bland and needed seasoning. Overall I am not coming back.
author: Edward M.

description:
Oh my god...call me crazy, but I do like this place.

The sliders are delicious, but the one made from turkey burger and some goat cheese. HOLY HANNAH! That is a great taste combo. I was floored by a slider.

Im sure with such a HUGE menu, they manage to make something mediocre...but it wasnt on my table the day I went to visit!

I recommend this tourist trap, because its a cute part of Americana/ San Fran and I personally liked it. I hope my next experience is a great!
author: Blume S.

description: Terrible service, disrespectful staff and subpar food. Wouldn't recommend to anyone. Save yourself a headache and go anywhere else. Cheers ~
author: Zach H.

description: The complimentary bread was the best thing here. Server was an odd character. Too sarcastic.
author: James V.

description:
Food is usually very good, but the service is horrible, i mean really horrible. As i sit here in a booth waiting to order all the waitstaff is seated and eating. They seem oblivious to their customers. Unfortunately i have experienced this here for over a year and a half. I am thinking it has to do with poor managment.....i only come back because i love the ruben sandwitch.  As i look around i see a  number of customers with empty glasses, yet still the staff sit eating and chatting with each other. Hey Max, what happened to your place? Are you making so mu h money you you just don't care? If that is the case that attitude will cause this location to go thr way of the others.....CLOSED.  shame on you Max!

Just confirmed with one of the staff Max's was sold 6 years ago.....did not realise it was that long ago....said it is now a franchise....well i guess that explains it. Also they expect the customer to pay their share of healthy sf. Its a surcharge on yhe check. This place is going to go the way of the doodoo. A crying shame.
author: david b.

description: I miss the Jewish delis in LA but this is a good alternative. Matzo ball soup and latkes- YUM! what else do u need? All these reviews of people ordering Jambalaya or Huevos Rancheros and wondering why they are disappointed were setting themselves up for failure. If you want Mexican go to a Mexican restaurant, if you want Jewish deli fare, come here!
author: Karina N.

description:
After a fourth second chance, the truth must be told. 

 The basic foundation of any good sandwich is the bread.  The bread is the obvious building block for a good sando no matter what you put in between.  With this said, off I go to Max's for yet another tragic experience.  Real busy evening, so I sat at the counter.  The bartenders (two woman) were chatting it up and really could care less about their customers at the counter, nor I imagine the whole place for they are the beverage makers for all.  After I ordered a cocktail, I put my food order in at the same time.  One of the bartenders was wiping silverware in front of me, handling the top of the silverware to wipe the handles, enough said.  I ordered the simplest of all dishes one could at a "Diner", a corned beef sando with potato salad and slaw on the side.  The only bright spot of this clip joint is that my food came out quickly.  The bread (RYE OF COURSE) was of the cheapest, low end brand possibly known to man.  The crust of a good rye should have a snap to it, the bread should have some substance in order to handle the weight of even a small sando.  I could have taken both slices and squeezed them up into a little ball for they had no weight no substance and worst of all, zero flavor, YES bread should have flavor, especially rye bread.  The corned beef was dry with no juice and very little seasoning at all.  It tasted like supermarket meat that was in your home frig for 2 weeks.  The potato salad was served in a little ceramic cup.  Once I turned it over it fell out of the cup on the plate as if it was hard construction spackle, dry flavorless gunk, that was obviously sitting in that cup for a long time.  The Cole slaw, well, listen, if I wanted a healthy meal I eat some spinach and drink some type of seaweed juice served to me by a mermaid.  I don't want shredded cabbage with two strips of carrots and no mayo.  On the dry scale the corned beef and potato salad made the Cole slaw seem dripping wet with lovely deliciousness.  

  Who am I going to complain to, the bartender who just grubbed up the fork she will give to the next customer, why waste my time.  I got up and found the "manager", an Asian fellow.  He was extremely busy so I asked to talk with him and stood back until he had a moment.  When he did, I calmly explained to him that the food was BAD!   At this time a white fellow (manager?) came up to us and abruptly interrupted us and began to quiz me on how much of the food I ate, what I had to drink, was it paid for etc.  I explained to him that I was not after a free 3 bites of the sando and a drink, which I would have paid for.  However, after this rude abrasive nasty little man kept pressing the issue, I asked for my bill, paid it, took one last look around never to return

  What a wonderful place Max's Opera café used to be.  Now it is just a clip joint for tourists, one time patrons or folks who just drink there and know better then to eat dried out bad food.  Please everyone, find something better then this, for $30.00 for a drink and a sando, we deserve it!!!!
author: Rusty G.

description:
The pianist really makes this place special. He's amazing. And such a character. :)

The food is all right. But the predictability (I guess the positive word is "consistency") I sometimes actively crave. For my boyfriend, portion size by far outweighs any other considerations, so it never fails to please him. I think the last time we went, in July, he had a Thanksgiving dinner plate or something! Turkey, mashed potatoes, carrots. lol

I really like the roasted beet salad, but I liked it better at the Max's in the Stanford Shopping Center. Maybe because I ordered it pretty early in the day, so they had *just* roasted the beets? The warm beets resting on the cold salad was the perfect combination. When I had the same salad at this location, the beets were cold, and that somehow worsened the salad for me. (And it was cold outside! But that's not your fault, Max.)
author: Cici M.

description:
It has to be said. Well, we all know Max's now sucks. It was sold to a Gaelic businessman and years of recipes and hard work have been thrown under the bus, a long articulated MUNI one. Max's was known for Matzo Ball Soup. Well, this soup now has a horrible greasy flavor and solid dumplings ...so far from matzo ball soup that Pluto thanks MAX gratefully (that's my dog). Really, you have to taste this stuff once in a while if you are going to sell it.

Oh, if that was only the half of it. I would give MAX negative stars for the way the current owner has destroyed an institution! I have tried it many times in the last year, only to be disappointed again and again. Don't even get me started on the untrained staff that now work there. They don't even know how to take a phone order, much less wait on a table in MAX style.
author: Edi M.

description: I used to eat the Chinese chicken salad 15 years ago. It was so good and fresh that it was the basis of how I judged all other salads. I went there today and had one of the greasiest, saddest salads ever. Today it is extremely deep fried and breaded chicken, deep fried peanuts, lettuce and hoisen sauce. No other vegetables. I wonder if anyone there has even eaten it, I doubt it.
author: Marcia O.

description:
What's up with Max's?
Two weeks ago, I tried to make a reservation for dinner this past Friday the 19th.  The restaurant wasn't listed on Open Table, just the other locations.  Checked back on the 17th and there's the restaurant.  Made a reservation for dinner in advance of a concert at 7:30.
Walked in, was seated right away.  It took about 10 minutes to get offered bread/water, take order, once that happened another 15 minutes to get food.  Clock is ticking . . .
The restaurant is busy, old folks, families, couples out for a date, but the majority of us are seated in the front room, closest to the kitchen and the exit.  The back room I notice is practically empty.
Food comes, hamburger for the kid, Chinese chicken salad for me - chicken on salad in strips, with fried crust falling off.  Hamburger is a bit dry, but fries are hot.  Overall a "ok" meal, though the table next to us, was not happy at all about the service.  They were very vocal about their displeasure.
And a side note, the hostess, cute young woman, wearing leggings and a short top, I think she forgot to put on her skirt.  Overall entertaining meal.  I don't know if I would go back, I am still on the fence on that.
author: Ann R.

description: Went there for dinner there the other night and was amazed! After being seated at my table, the server came with a great smile and great attitude. Throughout the night, he was an outstanding server overall and his voice was amazing when he sang during our meal. For people who don't know, most of the servers sing opera by the piano in front of everyone in a section of the restaurant. My meal was most excellent and make sure to save room for dessert! Great restaurant and great service! Can't wait to go there again!
author: Kevin A.

description:
I hate to give Max's one star, but it deserves it. Went over after the ballet. Both of us have been going to this place for many years, although neither of us has been there lately. We had reservations and were seated by a harried and overworked hostess after waiting our turn in line. We were given a nice table by the window, but our experience went down hill after that. The table was clean, but very sticky -- this was probably a problem with an inappropriate finish for the table. The waitress came by after about 15 minutes, brought our drinks about 10 minutes later, took our order and promptly forgot about it. We reminded her and finally got our meal after about an hour's wait. The place was obviously sorely understaffed. I was given the wrong dish -- an appetizer, not the entree I ordered -- but was not charged for it. My wife got a corned beef sandwich with stale bread. I ordered a second beer, but I sent it back, after having waited so long that I had given it up for dead. The men's restroom was dreadful -- urine splashed all over the floor and a large roll of paper towels lying on the sink, next to a water-stained notice about saving water. I went in at the end of our meal -- no change. Near our table, the carpet was cut from one wall to the other, its fraying edges lying open. The rest of carpet looked like it hadn't been swept all day; it was strewn with crumbs and sundry debris. 
         It's sad to see the deterioration in both food, service, and physical surroundings. We'd love to return, but before that happens, we'll have to hear of some improvement from friends or see some more positive reviews.
author: John Q.

description: Uncomfortably loud and crowded, with dismally slow service. Wooden painted tables are not level so glasses slide toward one corner; chairs crammed in so tight that everyone has to get up for anyone to get out. Long line for 2-stall ladies room with no paper towel and decrepit air dryers. Tempted to walk across the street to McDs for something to eat while waiting, or for an adequately cooked burger - Max's "medium well" is raw in the middle. Reserved for 12 2 weeks in advance but still seated at 2 tables. Neglected and neglectful, poor value.
author: Cathy B.

description: Very lovely place for dinner, while still keeping a comfortably casual feeling. The food is good, as is the service. They have live piano music, and the windows opening out onto South Van Ness make it great for the start or close of an evening out. Max's is a place that reminds me why I love living in San Francisco. It's nice, even fancy, but without pretension. Cap it off with a night-time walk around the lit up City Hall or maybe walking down to Smuggler's Cove for a drink, and you'll have a fine evening.
author: Al S.

description:
Who can eat here on their lunch hour when you have to burn over ten minutes just waiting to order in an empty restaurant? Meanwhile three or four employees are just standing around talking to each other while I search on my phone to find another place to eat.  Then my waitress appears for the first time when I hear her and the hostess get into a subdued but clear verbal altercation.  
 As always the food here is 5 stars.   Food came quick and I loved it.  Check took forever.  Service is two stars.  I recommend take out over staying to eat if you're on your lunch hour.
author: W. H.

description:
There isn't a better place in the city to honor your Jewish roots than at Max's and over a steaming bowl of matzoh ball soup.

My turkey sandwich was pretty standard, but the matzoh ball soup was close to extraordinary.  Wonderfully seasoned chicken soup, fluffy matzoh ball, lots of noodles.  Easily the best bowl of soup I've had in a long time, and the perfect remedy for a chilly summer night in the city.
author: Joanne G.

description: This used to be one of my favorite places, deli-style.  But that was years ago.......   I've been here twice in the last 2 years, and won't ever come again.  The food is mediocre at best; the prices are quite high.  I think it's a shame there isn't someone who cares about food and dining to run this place.
author: Llyana L.

description:
Not the best food, but the service was even worse. Our waiter was clearly disappointed that we weren't ordering alcohol that night, and subsequently, neglected us for the hour we were there. We kept having to grab other waiters/waitresses to ask for more water and napkins. 

With so many delicious places in the city, I don't know why anyone would waste a meal here!
author: K. D.

description: My husband and I went for the 1st time, amazing really good food I was very pleased. Thank you
author: C. M.

description:
I do not write a lot of reviews but What happened to Max's????
I use to stop by and eat a few times a month and order from Waiters about once a week..  Use to have the best Turkey dinner in town now HORRIBLE.  Menu was shrunk in half lots of good things missing when you go into the restaurant service not very good, employees don't seem happy.  What Happened so SAD
author: gail f.

description:
Service, pretty good up until the end, then it kinda fell short.. BUT worse than anything, the food..................... ordered "hot" pastrami and when I received it, it was room temperature at best.. Also, was a bit on the fatty side.. The Caesar Salad was nothing to write home about as the dressing was kinda runny...
The Lamb Meatballs were dry and tasted gamey......... (in other words, OLD) the dessert (namely, the Niagra Falls Cake) was oily and just disgusting.... 

My friend ordered "hot" Corned Beef and Pastrami, like mine was not warm AT ALL.... and his bread was NOT toasted at all.... (not sure if the waiter screwed that up or the kitchen) 

Lastly, the staff could be made to wipe down the menus............. There was old junk on them.. not to mention, the table wasn't well cleaned.... 

This place used to be good years ago when it first opened.. Either it's changed ownership or if not, then the original owner no longer cares what they serve... 

Save your money, go to the Mc Donald's across the street... At least their food is consistent....
author: Franco L.

description:
Went to Max's after a disappointing sushi dinner (documented here) to eat second dinner.  Yes, second dinner.  I managed to eat a whole burger here and the burger was good, but that was probably influenced by my hunger and disappointment in the sushi dinner we had already eaten.  The girlfriend ordered Mississippi Mud Pie (she went straight for dessert) and it looked delicious, enough so that she took some home.

An insider tip here is to request the bread.  They give bread at the table but only upon request.  The Girl has come here a number of times (I've only been here once) and she enjoys going despite having once found hair in her food, and her friend once being served undercooked chicken.  I guess that says something about the fries because that's what she raves about most here.
author: Marvin P.

description: Max's for at least two decades has been a great, consistent full service joint that has wonderful enticements in addition to the copious size of there portions.  I've gone there so many times and at some many of their once vast group of locations and always come back to The Opera Plaza original.  We've been going recently every Friday night and unfortunately we stopped after most of noticed little changes and short cuts creeping into the menu and service.  Our last visit was our final visit, at least for the time being, because one in our regular group who normally orders their recently shrinking burger, decided to order the Old Fashion Turkey dinner which sounds great on the menu and was a startling, beyond repair disaster that night.  It came after the rest of us had our entree's and when it came we all shuddered as we looked at the platter.  There were the potatos, carrots, cranberry sauce, but the turkey itself was Kirkwood Luncheon slide turkey rolled up to make it look a little better than it is.  Everything on his plate cold and he asked the waiter what happened to fresh cooked REAL turkey and the waiter was at a loss and seemed embarrassed about the $18.95 presentation.  He wanted nothing to replace his dinner and each of the rest of us experience sympathy pains and felt like we were being ripped off by Max's for the first time in all those years.  My burger and the patty melt the week before have shrunk, the portions of everything seems to have grown smaller almost overnight, and the staff seems new to boot.  I have no idea what is going on there, but it's sad and I'm sorry to not have Max's as part of our regular dining, especially because we all love the piano bar man, Larry O'Leno, he's stellar.
author: Stu S.

description:
amazing desserts!! HUGE for not that much $$! 

Classic sundae is great, but be sure to get multiple spoons!
author: Mel D.

description:
This place is kind a dump and by kind of I mean really. I can't believe the mall has nothing else to offer, really. Although, the patio dining would be a great attraction, I guess, but the menu is so overwhelming and the decor is retro-90s at best and everything is a hot mess, including the servers.

We ordered some of their "famous" fries, which were only O.K. Everyone else got sandwiches which were huge portions but nothing to write home about. My French dip was actually pretty good, but stil nothing amazing. Honestly, I'd rather go to Subway.

I don't really understand this place, either. Opera singers? I heard people used to sing here... what? It's kind of like a diner and a musical combined stuck in the 90s on an episode of Cheers? Ugh.
author: christine c.

description:
The absolute best thing about Max's? THE DESSERTS!!!!

That and the rules...they are phrased in a way that will make you smile but at the same time they take care of the little things that you may or may not notice when you go to a restaurant. 

Good food and friendly staff. Overall a nice dining experience.
author: Vanessa J.

description: Had brunch here recently. Food was OK--not great but OK. But the service was terrible. The waiter didn't know the menu and service was slow and worst yet the waiter was just indifferent. In fact whole staff was indifferent. This place used to be good but now it is at best only just OK.
author: Bill B.

description: We came here tonight before a concert. We had a party of eight and our waiter was lackluster to say the least. My husband said he was overwhelmed I just think that he was just a crappy waiter. They have a nice happy hour which I would recommend in the future. The Lamb burger I word was mediocre at best. Location is awesome food is average service sucks.
author: Tiffany S.

description: The worst service ever! We waited over 45 minutes for our food, no bread until we asked for it and then screwed 2 of our orders. I haven't seen such bad service  in long time.
author: Olga S.

description:
We have been coming to the many Max's Restaurants in Bay Area for over 20 years and always found the food and service to be very good. Unfortunately the service at this location has gone down hill very fast and that is too bad as was very good in the past. They forget your orders, bring the wrong food, servers disappear for long periods of time when your food sits on the kitchen shelf ready to go and then bring one plate 20 minutes after everyone else is finished and then say nothing of an apology. When you say "wow that took a long time" they say nothing and turn away.
What a joke for service. Such a huge difference in service wiithin maybe 6 months tells us something has gone wrong at this location. Will continue with the other few remaining locations as the food is still good.
author: Allan N.

description:
Max's is a nice place to go for a casual sit down meal when you're craving traditional american fare.  I've had great service (with one exception; at Max's on the Square once) and I can't imagine a better salad than the skirt steak cobb.  It's amazing.  

Too bad Max's on the Square closed.  It was a nice option before going to the theater.
author: Michael P.

description: Good spot, good food, and amazing Rye Bread, definitely get a loaf of the California Caraway Rye to take home.  Nice location, but nothing to special about it.
author: Benjamin F.

description: This place is a staple, especially being so centrally located to different entertainment venues, but when they get it wrong...man do they get it WRONG! Came in to an empty restaurant and then just as our server took our order a table if 24 sat down. Forget any semblance of service thereafter and even a comment about how disappointed I was in part of my meal was ignored, thanks Monte! Next time I'll go to Mel's, at least there I know what I'm getting.
author: Jose H.

description: food is excellent.  great spot lunch or dinner.  superb take out unit.  cannot beat their sandwiches.  tom cannon mill valley
author: Tom C.

description: Great food in healthy portions.  The menu has a huge selection which makes it a great place to bring the kids.  Save room for dessert!
author: Judith M.

description: This review is for take out only. I have never sat down and ate in this establishment, but will plan to in the future. I ordered the Salmon burger. This burger was huge! The bun was nice and sweet and the salmon was perfect and not dry. My order came with fries which was pretty good. I liked how crispy and thick the fries were. I never liked soggy fries unless you are eating Poutine. That's a different story. I called in my order and the lady told me the wait is about 15 mins. When I go and pick up my order the worker in the front handling the take out orders are very attentive. I paid and received my order in an instant. Now that I don't work in SF anymore, I thought I wouldn't enjoy this Salmon burger anymore. That was not true. There is a Max's near my current work in Oakland that's walking distance. Go figure. I guess the next review will be how the Max's in Oakland compares to the one in SF. Stay tuned.
author: Steven O.

description:
Went for dinner with friends and the lovely dining partner.
Major plus: gluten free menu
Major negative: crappy service

Iced tea was never refilled, Cosmo took about 10 minutes to get, even though we were sitting next to the bar. my gluten free chicken piccata was decent, and I made it a light dinner by splitting it with a friend. But, we were not given an extra plate, which disappointed me. friend loved the cabbage soup, but we specifically went there for this! 

Oh, the crazy thing that happened is our bill showed an incorrect price for something. The server instead of being nice and checking it questioned us several times and finally said he'd check with the manager. Turns out we were given an outdated drinks menu, and miss photographic OCD mind of my lovely dining partner was correct. No apology, just a correction on a bill. This took almost 20 minutes total; no fun when you're on your way to the fabulous SFGMC! 

Would we go back? Probably, but only if we were going back to Davies or the ballet or opera. Why? This celiac doesn't worry all that much about eating here, although we all know eating out is a risk.
author: Carla S.

description:
Hi there,

I just tried to make a reservation like 6 times.  Your receptionist has put me on hold but will not talk to me.  This is totally ridiculous.  If I did not have fond memories of going to your restaurant with my grandmother when I was little for my birthday then I would write you off completely.  I don't really know what to do because my parents are quite old and cannot wait around for a table without a seat.  Anyway, hope business is going well, I would love to come eat there tonight at 6, but I guess I will be going elsewhere.  As someone who has worked in customer service jobs and has phone skills, I am not one to be difficult with people in service jobs, but this is absurd.

Hope business continues to go well because apparently you're too busy for my business.

All the best,
Julia

**I will point out that my parents can stand and are not THAT old, but you know, you gotta make a statement.  I also don't like standing for 40 min.
author: Julia D.

description:
Haven't been here for years and not sure it's a place we care to visit anymore.

Just when hubby was about to pull into the garage, I thought of the chocolate cake we've had at Max's...all I remember was a tall cake with layers and layers of moist chocolate cake and cream...so to take care of my sudden craving, hubby backed out and headed toward Max's.

He dropped me off and I dashed in to see what kind of desserts may be available.  I saw my ultimate chocolate cake along with others...got a slice of the ultimate chocolate cake and carrot cake at $7.50 each - I was asked if I wanted a small or large slice - guess a small slice is half of what I got?  

It took a while before I was helped and that's after I asked if anyone can help me...and they were not busy.  

It took care of my craving but not impressed...
author: Gloria H.

description: MICE RUNNING UNDER THE TABLES. I went there on tuesday and saw at least four different critters collecting crumbs in the carpet. I told the staff and was ignored. So disgusting!
author: Angie A.

description: I have loved this place since my very first hangover in San Francisco. 15 years ago. The best place ever for Matzo Ball Soup. That stuff cures everything. Staff has always been warm and welcoming. Great place for a nice lunch with a full bar, nothing else like it in the neighborhood, or in the city. Thank you for many years of service! Perfect for entertaining out-of-towners, always something on the menu for everyone. Even the pickiest brother-in -law. Excellent quality, very efficient togo counter.
author: Chelse B.

description:
Max's, like much of San Francisco, is near and dear to my heart due to my many summers and trips up north for the summer.

My uncle first took me and my family here years ago.  It was my first experience with a dry aged steak, and my god, was it a steak. I remember the wide spread of amazing appetizers and the wonderful staff.

Years later, I still venture out to Max's, and while the dry aged steaks are no longer on the menu, the meals here are still to die for.  I had a hamburger steak with blue cheese on my last visit (lunch), and my date and I had a wonderful time, and as always, the service was brilliant.

I come for the food, but stay for the brilliant music.
author: Julian J.

description:
Amazing Dinner and Service- 
Service from :Monica and Arianne
Dinner the sole 
and choc chip cheese cake 
Burlingame location.  
Awesome/Amazing !!
author: Estev B.

description: We almost always eat at Max's before an opera. Their salads are superb, and my absolute favorite is the shrimp Louie. The shrimp is perfectly fresh, and the salad has all the other wonderful things one enjoys, such as ripe avacoado, boiled egg, tomato, fresh greens, and other delightful tastes. This past Wednesday, my husband also enjoyed the shrimp Louie. Max's always serves delicious, warm, fresh sour dough rolls and butter right when one is seated. For some reason, our rolls did not arrive until we were half way done with our salads, even though we asked our server about them. Our server seemed somewhat unsure of himself; perhaps he was new. We also ordered a bottle of California Chardonnay to accompany our meal. With tax and tip, our bill was very close to $100.
author: Neanna M.

description:
This review is ONLY about Max's "Seven Dollar Ultimate Chocolate Cake Slice."

The food at Max's is only about two steps above Chevy's or any local "upscale" chain restaurant. 

Translation: Max's wouldn't be on my list of places to eat if I were showing friends or family around SF for the first, second, third, or 100th time. 

End rant. 
Begin Review.

One good thing about Max's is its EXTENSIVE dessert menu... 
OMG... Even a diabetic will find something to love since Max's also has an EXTENSIVE sugar free dessert menu also...

Anyway, Max's Ultimate Chocolate Cake is the boooooooomb! Rich. Dark. Sweet. And Yummy....

And I should note that I'm an extensive chocolate cake lover, so I don't give that "shout out" lightly... lol

The only issue I have with Max's Ultimate Chocolate Cake is the debate if Max's makes the cakes themselves, or ship them in from a local bakery. Hence the "three-star" rating. 

I can't be giving Max a four star salute if they're not actual cake maker... lol

Additionally, A warning to the guys: You're date, wife, girlfriend, mistress, WILL tell she will only take a "small" bite out of your cake slice and that you can have the rest. DON'T BELIEVE HER!!!! She will 1) either eat your entire cake after a few quick bites or 2) she will hate you for eating the entire cake and not offering her more bites.... LOL
author: Black K.

description:
I was recommended to try out Max's for weekend breakfast/brunch by a San Francisco native. It is within walking distance from our hotel (which is in a questionably safe area, to say the least), but by the time we reached Max's we were in love with the feel of things. 
It's a really big space, with plenty of seating and a piano area, which was not being used but I assume they have some cool piano bar nights here. Chandeliers throughout the dining area make for a fancy feeling atmosphere without the pressure of dressing up and spending tons of $$.
