go to Max's, you wont be let down.
author: Erin F.

description: This place is popular probably for specific dishes on the menu.  It used to be a great destination for late night dining and large groups craving deli food when there were fewer options.  For the most part, the food is mediocre but you can share a huge, monster sandwich with a gigantic side of slaw or fries.  The takeout line is slow during the week.  I agree with Molly B. that the place and menu are strange.
author: M.D. L.

description: I used to love this place especially late at night but the food went way down hill.  The chicken soup (their specialty) is so salty and tastes old.  Thought it was just an off night but it isn't ever very good now.  The bar has good wines not too expensive & friendly barkeeps.  Go to the counter because table service is slow.
author: mike d.

description:
I won't add too much to what's already written but to say these three things:

1.  I love the chicken matzo ball soup here.  When I'm sick, I'll definitely make a trip here to pick some up.

2.  It is not possible for a human being to finish any one of their dishes since the portions are huge!  And honestly, it's to the point of being absolutely ridiculous if you don't come to eat here with your 30 closest friends.  Maybe they ought to look at half sizes?

3.  Some dishes are good, but many times I've been disappointed.  This has made me wary to try much beyond some of the appetizers, the soup and the chicken salad sandwish.

4.  The desserts are ridiculous in size, but the ultimate chocolate cake is a definite winner.  Yum!  Again, due to portion sizes, if you eat a meal, you probably won't be able to do dessert.  So plan accordingly!
author: N S.

description: Food was FABULOUS!!  I got the Seared Ahi Salad.  Nice portion, I don't know what these skinny bitches on here are saying but, it was the puurfect size.  My friend got the cheese burger, medium rare, with seasoned fries.  Both entrees were some of the best gourmet comfort-food I've tasted in a very long time.  Yummy.
author: C W.

description: The food here USED TO BE great,SOMETIMES. It was ALWAYS hit and miss. The service is hit and miss. The prices are far TOO high for the lack of service. I went w/ a friend for lunch yesterday. When I asked the waitstaff what type of greens they used in their dinner salad, she sighed(HEAVILY) and said,"Well," "since it is SALAD," "It would be safe to assume it's lettuce!!" Then, turning on her heels and dismissing us, altogether, she stomped away. We were then left to sit there for 10 more minutes before she returned. When she did(return) she looked at me and said, "What will you be having?," intoning not to ask anymore questions. At this point I was livid. So I quipped, "Well," "If I knew if there was arugala in the damn salad," I may have ordered that with a bowl of soup." "However," "We've decided to luncheon elsewhere." BAD SERVICE. GIVE A S__T ATTITUDES, OVERPRICED FOOD. YIKES!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Sabrina R.

description: The first of Max's 17 Laws is testimony to why this dining spot is as popular as it is - "This restaurant is run for the enjoyment and pleasure of our customers, not the convenience of the staff or the owners." Its motto is "Everything You Always Wanted to Eat," while at the same time warning "This is a bad place for a diet!," and no wonder - overstuffed deli sandwiches, gigantic salads, and large-enough-to-share main course specialties, plus addictive fresh-baked breads and decadent desserts made on the premises, have been signature items on the extensive menu from day one. That's not to say that the kitchen doesn't have the diet-conscious in mind. Whether on Atkins or South Beach, those watching their food intake can enjoy a number of items on a carb-conscious menu. Everyone else can indulge in the likes of tender, meaty barbecued spareribs in a tangy sauce, brisket of beef in a honey-caraway gravy, or linguini tossed with portabello mushrooms, roasted garlic, fresh herbs, and extra virgin olive oil. Corned beef and pastrami sandwiches have just the right amount of fat and are as good as any found in New York City. French fries are crisp and relatively grease-free. Even the iced tea is special here - you allow it to brew to the preferred strength in a small pot before pouring it into a tall glass. And when you request a refill, you'll get new tea bags, not just hot water to add to those you've already used. Desserts are sinfully rich and large enough to be enjoyed by two . . . or three. The gimmick that differentiates this Max's from others in the chain are the servers singing operatic arias and Broadway show tunes. Don't be surprised if the waitress who just served your Caesar salad is now in the spotlight belting a la Merman. A word of warning: avoid a table close to the small stage. When the staff isn't singing, a pianist is tinkling the keys, and conversation can be difficult.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Come here for the portions, not for the nuanced flavor! It reminds me of the interior of a Sambo's restaurant from the early 70s. The food is decent, never awful, and the serving sizes are GENEROUS. They also have a full bar which helps on those evenings when you have to wait for a table.
author: Tim G.

description: Their Matzo Ball Soup is the only game in town. Drinks are generous. If you're in the neighborhood, stop by. Watch out though - the waiters sing at the piano.
author: Maximilian A.

description:
I was walking around town with my girlfriend and a friend last night desperately looking for somewhere to eat. It was getting later and things were closing. Then I remembered hearing about this Max's place not too far from where we were. I am from the East Coast and have had my fill at the NJ/NY/Philly delis and have never been disappointed. I was curious to see if this place could satisfy as well.

ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE!

The server was perhaps the worst I have ever had. She didn't listen to a word any of us said. My girlfriend asked for a lemon slice for her water three times and the waitress still didn't bring it after 20 minutes, so I went to the the back and found her and kindly asked her for it. She apologized but kept up her goofy grin. Then we ordered and got our food. I ordered the brisket, which was dry and bland, joined by practically raw broccoli and a latke that was basically IHOP hashbrowns in circular form. Disgusting, and the portions were not anywhere near the sizes on the East Coast and way more expensive too. My girlfriend got a burger with avocado, which of course the waitress forgot. She dropped the food off then walked away. We waited about ten minutes then I had to go to the back to find her again and remind her. We ate and when she came to check on us and ask how the food was, I said it was ehhhh, and she said, "Great!" smiling the whole time. She didn't listen at all. Then we had to wait another 20 minutes for the bill after we had finished. 

So moral is, the food was mediocre at best and definitely not worth the price and the service was downright terrible. I would never go to this place again and would not recommend it to anyone.
author: Saikat P.

description:
it used to be okay from what i can remember....that's no longer the case!
i have a lump in my stomach as i write this review
i must agree with another review about the GIANT mushroom caps, the only thing giant is the pictures of them on the menu
then our waiter brought me the wrong salad which i hate to send things back but i didn't want chicken salad i wanted cobb salad with chicken,actually i'm wrong...the salad and my friends reuben came before the mushrooms..ooops!
then we braved the onslaught of blonde children coming from the nutrcracker matinee and ordered the coconut crumble which we watched melt sitting next to someone else's patty melt under the pass through window. the sundae was good but wait for it...there was no hot fudge...reading this review back to myself maybe i have a lump in my gut from overeating,but no i split everything with a friend and belive me there was a lot on the plates that went into the trash.
oh and our server was a little creepy and no personality, which i know it's a shit job i did it for 8 years or so,but creepy doesn't make tips,bitches do though, that's how i survived.
 the 2 stars are for the martini and the bread, they were good
the singer was funny though!
author: brooke h.

description: i`m a fan of the corned beef reuben, hardcore! only been here once but i was really happy with the experience. my sandwich made me super happy; i don`t think you can find a reuben that good anywhere else. it`s definitely enough reason for me to wanna come back. loved the potato salad too.,. iono why but i get really happy when i taste good potato salads. our waiter was lovely and the place was lovely. i liked everything i tried. i guess the only thing i didn`t like was the percentage that they add to your bill for charity purposes (i guess?) it`s a nice gesture and all but i don`t know how i feel about forcing charity on people. geez, i just wanna sandwich, i can`t afford to donate money every time i get it :{
author: Anjelica C.

description: First, the food was exceptional. Pot pie, BLT with avocado sandwich. Bistro salad and Russian cabbage soup truly tasty. But the service was abysmal. The waiter did all he could but there wasn't enough staff. We had an hour and a half and after waiting 30 minutes for a table (which we expected) and being ready to order when we sat down, we waited 10 minutes to order and waited another 40 minutes for food. With less than 10 minutes to enjoy the great food, we were unhappy. The manager did give us a 20% discount but that didn't make up for a poor experience.
author: t m.

description: When we're in the city on a budget, we come here.  We usually split the pot pie and a drink or two.  It's huge and yummy and we can leave with full bellies and some extra cash for drinking later.  Its cozy and service is usually pretty good.  Maybe next time we'll try one of the desserts on display when you walk in.
author: Barbara m.

description: i suggest the crabcake sandwich- its flaky and crispy a well made crabcake which most places cant seem to do right. not only is it gynormous but it also comes with fries and cole slaw, everything here is big. i especially appreciate the staff with really courteous and friendly servers and hosts/hostesses. just try to avoid after nutcrakcer and ballet hours around 4:30-5pm when it gets pretty busy with often times a wait.
author: Jennifer C.

description: yeah this place is a little on the pricey side, but its worth it. great location, HUGE portions of food, and a live pianist. great place to grab dinner. they also have a full bar which is nice when u have to wait for a table. i'd probably give it 5 stars but they eliminated my favorite item from the menu!! wtf?? the bbq chicken was to die for! everyone needs to order a side of the thin fried onions.
author: Andrew T.

description: Eh.  You know, Max's gets it done.  Go for a reuben at lunch if you're in the neighborhood.  Not worth a special trip by any means, but it does it's job, which is to be acceptable, clean and relatively comfortable.
author: Alice T.

description: my matzo ball soup tasted like an ultra-salty campbell's chicken noodle soup + mush (salty canned soup is usually redundant, except in this case).  they were out of key lime pie AND the apple pie.  wtf?!  the singers are mediocre at best, but they sound even worse when they turn up the volume.  the only redeeming aspects of this place are 1) it's open late and 2) the bread is free, warm, abundant, and comes in many varieties.  i like free.
author: Katherine K.

description: We used to love Max's and would go there every time we attended a concert at Davies but after tonight, we are NOT going there again!   Well, for the last few times, we realized the quality of food is no longer as good as before. Tonight was the last straw: The glass of water had a lipstick mark on it.  We asked the waiter to change it.  It came back with a piece of disgusting hair stuck on the rim.  They always bring a basket of bread as you get there. We had to ask for it and first we were given two pieces on a platter for 3 people and then they realized they had not brought out the usual bread basket.  But the most disgusting thing that caused us to decide not to go to Max's ever again was the piece of hair that I found in my Reuben sandwich.  It was so mingled with the sour kraut!  eek... totally lost my appetite but did not want to ruin it for the others on my table and did not make a scene out of it.  After I came home tonight and read all the reviews, I realized that we are not the only ones feeling the downhill situation of Max's in terms of quality and service.  You wouldn't expect such bad quality and carelessness from Max's considering the prices you pay.   Their sundae was good but not very tasty as before...maybe because I was afraid to find a third piece of hair!!   Forget Max's... we are NEVER GOING BACK  I miss the old Max's!
author: joe s.

description: I used to love to go to Max's. It is near work. The food used to be excellent and outstanding. Service is always A+  Don't know if they are having chef or cooking staff problems or whatever. They redecorated the one at the Opera Plaza. While the ambiance is still good, the food has slipped a bit. Don't crave it anymore like I used to. Hope they can step it up soon.
author: Brian K.

description: Okay food if you want cheap and quantity.  The singers make my head hurt badly.
author: danielle b.

description: Max's is many things right now - a neighborhood bar (bartenders exceptional) with friendly banter among regulars, newcomers, locals and event patrons, a deli/burger/comfort food place - nothing fancy but consistently high quality, and a quirky one-of-a-kind joint with singing waiters and an all-are-welcome attitude.   I was going to write a review about how disappointed I was in the Keller Burger Bar the other day until I realized that the sweet potatoe fries were better at Max's than at the Burger Bar, so I opted to give Max's Opera Cafe a heads up instead.
author: l h.

description: Now this place here Max Cafe is more like an upscale Opera with a bar. You have to a least look presentable and you better be willing to spend some money at least  $100-$200 because this place is not cheap. We heard about this place on are hunt to find good foods had to come check them out to see if the food was good. Boy were we disappointed! We went in hungry  I ordered a top of the line Steak with bake potato and some kind of green stuff that was suppose to be spinach. She ordered the cheese stuffed mushrooms with roma tomatoes Grilled Chicken tossed over pasta. After wait 15 to 25 minutes to get are food it sucked! I ordered my Steak medium it came back charcoal black all burt up dry and with no flavor what so ever! The Pasta was garbage no flavor with the Grilled chicken charcoal back and dry as well. What a rip off i would of ben better off going to Mc Donalds across the street. Wound I come back her No Never Again! My advice to you save your money and don't bother with this place.
author: The Food Hunters C.

description: Oh snap!!  Have you tried the chicken wings here????  Good lord they are tasty....
author: James B.

description: Huge!!  That is all I can really say. HUGE!  Not really my thing but I'm not going to say it's bad either.
author: Misti L.

description: You know, I think Max's has GONE down. I know each restaurant has it's own thing. Opera, cafe, etc, but the last time I went here I was so disappointed. Not only is the entry way strange, having to pass by the "kitchen" to get to the hostess stand, it seemed like it was a senior citizen special going on. My bro and I were the only people around that didn't have white hair!  The only thing I ever order here is their Russian Cabbage Soup. Usually it's full of flavor, hearty chunks of beef, good sized carrots and cabbage - but the last time I went it was like I had the bottom of their vat. It was "mushy" to say the least.  The redeeming quality is that you get a lot when you order, but then again their prices have gone up. They do have yummy raisin and sourdough rolls, but I always devour. But...next time I go back to the VanNess location, I'll have to think twice. Plus it's out in the middle of nowhere. Maybe the Union Sq will be better, but I fear that it will be packed full of tourists. I think I'll stick to the one in Stanford...
author: Natalie S.

description: really, really diverse menu.  super-attentive staff. unreal deserts.  the laws are also funny and adhered to.  not that i'd call a waiter out for checking with me 5 or 6 rather the "4" minutes after my food arrives, unless they were pissing me off to begin with, which has never been the case here. my new york buddy says they have the most authentic reuben this side of queens.  i adore the turkey pastrami and the chocolate macaroon. be warned... you're either gonna split it or take it home. HUGE. Ridiculously HUGE portions.  My only complaint is that the bar is tiny(as is the waiting area), so on busy nights there isn't really a place to sit and enjoy a pre-dinner "maxarita".
author: Jenni D.

description: It doesn't get better, great food, service and opera singers to serve you. We love it. There's no more to say.
author: Nicoletta K.

description: omg i love this place... the fact that i can get a uber huge meal at midnight  is such a draw... i haven't been to the one downtown, but they have one in burlingame, and i meet up with my friends there all the time... perfect for young professionals who work late, but still have the energy to meet up with friends to catch up on life... relaxed, friendly atmosphere makes it easy to forget the day's stresses...
author: Isa C.

description:
a whole lotta chicken pot pie = a whole lotta belly for me! sosososo good. 

i'm even more excited because my work does take-out from here. wow what a devilish way to make me stay late to finish my work...my bosses know me too well! 

good portions, good food, and if you're with good company, it's great fun! (wait...that sounded WAY cheesy)
author: Stefi C.

description: Always went at the height of the lunch rush, so not sure about other times. Service was spotty, due to previously mentioned circumstances. Food was good, portions are huge, but still too pricey for what is essentially diner food (done well).
author: Matt G.

description: I've always liked Max's ever since I was a kid.  There are multiple locations in the Bay Area, but this one is my favorite.  The waiters will often sing (sometimes accompanied by piano) as many of them are working there as a side job while also performing across the street at the San Francisco Opera.  The menu is huge, giving tons of options from big salads, sandwiches, steaks, etc.  I love the club sandwich and turkey burger.  Huge portions too, so do not fill up on bread (even though the cinnamon raisin roll is awesome).
author: Glen E.

description: Me and a group  friends was looking for a place to eat.  We ended up going to Max Opera Cafe. I have been to a Max but not the one on Van Ness Street. We found parking right away which was a sign for us. I ordered Crisp Salmon came with Green Beans and Crisp Potato which was good but I didn't like the sauce that was on my Salmon. My friends that I can remember ordered Pork Chop which was really good, I don't remember what her side was. My other  friend ordered Honey Chicken that came with Veggies. Some ordered hamburgers and sandwiches. The Chicken was nice and tender. I forget to mention we did order a salad before our meal. Beet Salad which was really good. I also ordered a Bloodymary which was way to spicy... :(  We saw that everyone was eating dessert and not ordering a meal so we wanted to taste there desert. We order Chocolate cake with a scoop of ice cream. The cake taste like Safeway cake, It was OK. Overall the food was good. I would go back there. It's nice and relaxing inside, they had someone playing the Piano and a waiter would once in a while sings. He was good and good looking. It's American food so for what it is it's good depending on what you get.
author: Ge I.

description:
People ask why Max's only has a three star rating; I will elaborate.  The place is managed by rookies!  It seems as though they are going through some changes and not everyone is on the same page.

The food used to be great!  I used to be a regular there.  As time passed and David Berkowitz (original owner) left the picture of the Opera Plaza location things have gone down hill.  It seems that the new owners want only to make a buck no matter how fast they rush you out of there.  Quality of the stay is not on the agenda.  

On a busy show night (Symphony, Herbst Theatre, Museum) you could wait to be seated for an hour or longer.  Management or the hostess just keep taking names and do not really show much concern about what time your show starts.  If I had any investment in this company; I would be a little more concerned with the people waiting in the restaurant.  If management does not know how to seat in a timely fashion then maybe they should have a host or hostess that has experience in that department. 

GARRETT!!!!!!!  WHERE ARE YOU?
And what happened to Garret?!!!!  Where the heck is he?  On Sundays he had a couple of old ladies that would come in for him and I just wonder how they now feel that he is gone.  He had to be one of the best servers in there.  He was on top of his game, he played the piano during the day which for the most part was unheard of.  The schedule says that the piano playing and singing begin at 6:30 p.m.  Garrett would play during the lunch hour made for a pleasant visit.  That gentleman had been there for a while at least as long as I had been enjoying the food 3 years or more.  Management, owners drove him out?  THAT WAS A BIG MISTAKE!!!!!!!  Bring back the quality and maybe you guys might get back those old customers(I DOUBT IT THOUGH).  As for now the place sucks the food is mediocre, and the management needs new training!  Servers that have been there a while know much more than what the management seems to know.  Emily seems to be giving the general manger pointers on things and doing a better job at it.  Why not put some of those servers into a position to help the current owners and or managers achieve greatness once again?  Oh yeah and maybe a manager standing up at the hostess stand should crack a SMILE once in a while;  it make the wait much more pleasant!!!  

There is a manager there that seemed to be the only one who could keep it together her name was Didit.  She was very low-key and it seemed that no matter what the problem she could take care of it quietly without making it into an ordeal.  Another manager Rosie, thought she was just a hostess?  She does not smile and mingles with her employees (the servers) too much during a shift.  She does not seem to have enough to do.  Put her at the hostess station seems that she was a server in that restaurant and has not had any other job in her life so the story goes.  

All and all the Reuben is to die for and the Philly Cheese Steak as well, but do not order anything else.  It is like they are trying to plate food that is being catered and it is not!  They are not up to that standard.  IT'S A CAFE FOR GOODNESS SAKES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I dare you to venture at your own risk as the quality goes down more and more each day.  Max's had something really good going there.  They really should thank the State Department across the street that will keep them in business.  

The meatloaf in the photo is not homemade contrary to popular belief it looks like a processed piece of meat.  Where does it come from.  Is it beef?
author: Anony B.

description: Great desserts!  Big enough to share, grand enough to make you reach for your camera.  But go someplace else to eat first - the "food" food is all pretty marginal, not worth saying much about.
author: Sophie B.

description: Bad... food is undercooked, or when cooked, dry. Salty beyond edible. Nice wait staff however.
author: Richard C.

description: I ate at Max's for lunch a few days back.  I went in about mid-afternoon in between the lunch and dinner crowds.  My girlfriend started off the meal with the Ultimate Maxarita. (What is almost always labeled as "Cadillac" in most other spots).  I tried a sip of the Maxarita, and honestly at the price it was a little light on the liquor. I went with an Anchor Steam. Overall we had a very nice time, I enjoyed some favorites such as latkes as well as a Reuben. If you come to Max's and try things like a Martini, Latkes, A Reuben and Cake you will probably like it. I tend to love the sliders on the menu (however I feel that they have gotten slightly lower in quality in recent years). Such a huge menu. The server did violate one of the rules which they said they abide to at Max's. It is a little pricey and I really don't like that deal where they charge you extra to cover paying employees paid time off. They were not a true four stars, but very close. 3.889 Stars
author: Max R.

description: i would rate this place 1 star but the food bumps it up another star ... the three or so times i came here to eat, the service was terrible!  i have eaten here for lunch and dinner and both times i had to wait extraordinarily long to order and then get food.  its a shame because i really like the food... soo ... good food, waaack service.  o btw "server =not singer"... the servers sing here- are they focused more on getting noticed or serving my food ... i really like the max's in burlingame however.  waaaay better service and the people there can actually sing.
author: Paul B.
